reviews.text: Awful.  Ordered a mushroom burger which came out with 3 leathery mushrooms and the burger was burnt.<br>Also ordered a skinny chicken pot pie. It was lukewarm and not good at all.<br>First time, we have been there, and we will never go back. The food was bad and also took 40 plus minutes to come out after we ordered.<br>For the amount of money we spent, the food should have been phenomenal.<br>Just bleech.

I travel a lot for work and appreciate Cheesecake Factory simply for the fact that I always know it&#39;s a safe bet. I can get the same meal and service here as I can in Buffalo, Seattle, OKC.... The service at this specific location was lovely, fast and attentive. I have no complaints!

I made arrangements to have brunch at the Westroads Mall location. We were promptly seated and the server took the drink orders and allowed us amenities time to peruse the menu. Bread was brought after the order was taken. Food was served quickly even though the restaurant was getting filled to capacity. Getting the check and take out containers took longer than it should from the server who was getting bombarded with requests from other nearby tables. The greeters did thank us upon leaving the restaurant which was unexpected. Overall, I had a pleasant experience at this location and will be back soon.

I would not recommend this restaurant if you want to make a reservation! I called this restaurant several times within 2 weeks of my birthday to reserve a table for 16 people. I was not allowed to make a reservation and they told me I was not guaranteed a table for a party of that size. They do however offer reservations for up to 6 people through the yelp app. I was turned away from coming to this restaurant for my birthday dinner even after offering to pay a percentage in advance to the server for tip. They refused my business and after this experience I will not come to this restaurant in the future. Luckily a smaller restaurant named &#34;Jams&#34; allowed me to reserve a table last minute and we ended up with 24 people, but the Cheesecake Factory made it clear they didn&#39;t want our business. No adult birthday parties allowed here!

So me and my friends visited the place. Had to wait long to get a seat but it was worth the wait.  We got a perfect table with a view outside and the weather that day added to the ambience. I ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta and along with that chicken samosas. Both were excellent and to add with it the Cabernet Sauvignon was just perfect. My friend ordered a veggie burger and margarita. He was also happy with the order. To end it all we ordered the classic cheesecake and a tiramisu cheesecake. I have always loved the cheesecake here. So in all a great experience. Nice ambience and good food.

We had a really kind server and the food was excellent as always!  We ordered several slices of cheesecake to go and when they were out of the white chocolate raspberry the server offered me several other options. I declined and when he brought our cheesecakes to us he let me know he&#39;d selected one of his favorites as an apology for not having the one we wanted!  We go here each time we are in Omaha and I highly recommend you do too!
Always great food and our waitress was awesome!  Will definitely be back again to enjoy the drinks and cuisine!

Went for Sunday brunch at 11am place was not busy at all. Waited 10 minutes before server came to our table we ordered ,then she came back with our drinks and some bread.  Waited 27 minutes before they brought out our food. Mine was Ice cold and mu husbands omelet was hot but his potatoes ice cold. Had to go find server to have her take food back never did get my food back so had manager take my meal off of bill. NEVER AGAIN will I go there.

Let me start by saying that I appreciate what this restaurant (as well as many others in the community) is doing to remain open and safe for dining in during these tough times. That said, we had a pretty disappointing experience last night when normally I&#39;ve had nothing but good experiences here in the past. First, many of the customers were not wearing masks when walking around the restaurant. In fact, they didn&#39;t even have masks at all. I understand this may be beyond the control of the restaurant and management staff, but I just want other potential customers to be aware as many other restaurants and businesses in the community are being very strict with not allowing those without masks in. We waited patiently for a table and when we were sat, the seats of the table were not cleaned well. There was grease and crumbs on the booth seat. This is disappointing considering the importance of proper sanitization with COVID. Second, we weren&#39;t given bread before our meal and had to ask our server for it. Then when our food came out, much of it was cold. At that point, we didn&#39;t bother sending it back because it was close to closing and we were just pretty hungry. Our server was not super attentive either and we had to get her attention for several things we needed throughout our meal. I&#39;ve worked in restaurants before so I am very empathetic and understanding of what this business and others are going through right now with the pandemic. However, I really think many of our issues with our visit were a bit disappointing.
Great brunch items. Great price. Super laid back atmosphere. Was a good time. Get cheesecake to go.

If you&#39;re placing a to go order make sure you have an extra 30-40 minutes to wait for it after the scheduled pick up time. Scheduled pick up was for 4:20 on a Wednesday and we finally got our order 35 minutes later! Food was tasteless but the cheesecake was good. If we go back it will only be for the cheesecake but then what&#39;s the point bc you can get it at Walmart/Costco now.

I&#39;m giving 4 stars as long as you know what you expect when going , this is a chain restaurant that does stuff ok. We got cheesecake to go this time. Peanut butter one was ok Oreo on was way to sweet

I did have some problems with picking my food order up at the Cheesecake Factory yesterday afternoon  In these times with the CV19 virus, many restaurants are trying to reconfigure how they serve their customer.  In this case, I selected curbside, which means a time is selected for the food to be ready, I show up, park in a designated area, let the restaurant know I&#39;m there with either a text, or phone call and the restaurant delivers the food to my car.  Minimal contact.  The Cheesecake Factory hasn&#39;t accomplished this procedure very well.  I was early.  I called the number to let them know I was there.  I told them what number stall I was parked, my type of car &amp; color, and I waited, and I waited, and I waited.  A car pulled up in the curbside delivery spot next to me.  They immediately got out of their car, went in and picked up their order and left.  I then got out of my car, went in and asked if I had the wrong interpretation of curbside food delivery.  They asked if I had called them to tell them I had arrived.  I said yes, in fact I was a few minutes early of the designated time.   They commented they were busy and had not been able to get to it (there was only 1 person sitting on the waiting bench as this was before 4 pm, I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory&#39;s all over the USA, they were not busy).  My 3 bags of food were on their bottom shelf, now just slightly warm and I had a 20 minute drive ahead of me.  I give the Cheesecake Factory only 1 out 5 stars for their process control and adherence to it.  The food was still good, but only lukewarm by the time we sat down to eat.  Bottom line?  There are equally good restaurants closer to me in Northwest Omaha.  They will always get the nod now before the Cheesecake Factory for curbside, take out and delivery.

This experience was awful.  Ordered scampi and pasta eas SO   I couldn&#39;t eat it. Complained to waitress and she offered mashed potatoes or other pasta. I chose pasta which was s dry sticky mess.  The customer next go me also ordered the same dish 20 minutes later and complained about the same thing. I spoke to the manager and she was not hellful. She looKed like she was going to challenge my complaint. No offer of any compensation.  Awful. Awful mgnt. Uneducated chef.   Never again at that location.  Too salty. Sorry.

We went on National Cheesecake Day and got there early so we didn&#39;t have to wait.  My husband ordered the Pasta Napoletana and I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta.  Both were great. I like that you can order off the lunch menu until 5:00 so that&#39;s what I did. Even the lunch portion was big enough for a couple of meals.  The Cajun Jambalaya Pasta is my favorite pasta but I decided to try something new.  <br> <br>I had planned on ordering the Snickers Cheesecake or Chris Outrageous Cheesecake but was told that neither one was available because they change flavors.  I was pretty surprised they would remove the Snickers Cheesecake as it is the #1 selling candy bar.  I ordered the Reeses Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake Cheesecake and my husband ordered the  Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar Cheesecake.  We asked that it be put in a to go box like we always do but she said because it&#39;s a special they have to serve it on a plate and then she will put it into a box.  Seems like more dishes to wash and more work for our waitress to me. Our waitress did a great job of keeping our drink glasses filled and boxing up our food. <br><br>I didn&#39;t care for my cheesecake.  The description said layers of caramel (which I love) but it was more like layers of peanut butter and it was too much for me. My husband enjoyed his.  Before our next visit I will be calling ahead to make sure they have my favorite cheesecake Snickers back into the rotation. I have a feeling I&#39;m not only complaint they have had about that.

I ordered a cheesecake online for my mother-in-law&#39;s birthday and as I was checking out, there was an option to add a dark chocolate &#34;Happy Birthday&#34; plaque, so I went ahead and added that to the order. BIG MISTAKE!!!! <br>Not only was my order not ready 45 minutes AFTER the pickup time assigned to me, the plaque looked like a kindergartener made it. <br>I am HIGHLY disappointed in what I received for $3.00.<br>Disappointing experience to say the least.
Food was delicious, drinks was served quickly but they forgot to serve my spouses wine. Their service does not reflect their price. I also order 3 cheesecakes to go and got no disposable forks.

Gosh. Me and my boyfriend came in last night. They &#34;didn&#39;t have any bread left&#34; so we received no bread. I thought they would give us something complimentary because that happened but no, it&#39;s just that&#39;s how it was. I order a shrimp bistro pasta and the shrimp is was not even breaded like how they would normally prepare it and I asked for parmesan and they said they were out for the night. I&#39;m not coming here again.

The only reason I&#39;m even giving 2 stars is because our waitress (Ashley G) handled our situation very well. <br>My boyfriend and I came in for a lunch date and were expecting to spend around $60 with a good tip. I had been boycotting CF for about 2 years after I spent $25 on one drink and slice of still frozen cheese cake. <br>Today I let my BF choose where he wanted to go for lunch, CF or cheddars and he wanted CF. <br>We were seated in a very cramped corner which wouldn&#39;t have been a problem but the women next to us had staring problems and we had no where to look other than at the wall or them.<br>There was also SO many flies. Everywhere, the ground, on the windows all over food. That comes to the ground as well, freakin crumbs, food, just nasty like they hadn&#39;t swept in days. <br>Like I said our waitress did amazing, we had ordered Crab Artichoke dip and it was horrendous. Smelled like cleaning supplies and the dipping bread it came with was harder than concrete. My BF said to our waitress it wasn&#39;t very good and she took it away and took it off the bill no questions asked. She said the manager would be coming to speak with us after he got out of a meeting but we watched him walk around and avoid our seating area. <br>When the bill came it was $35 for one nacho appetizer and 2 slices of mainly frosting cheese cake. <br>Overall the server was a 10/10 thank you Ashley G <br>The food was a 2/10 <br>And the prices were a 0/10

If you are worried about safety and exposure to Corona virus, do not eat at The Cheesecake Factory. They are not organized enough to provide a safe and healthy environment. We had a reservation through Yelp but waited in a crowded entrance for over 30minutes before being seated. There was no way to socially distance. Even if you waited in your car until table was ready you&#39;d still have to walk through the crowded waiting area. The bar area was not open and every other table was blocked but what&#39;s the use if everyone risks exposure while waiting? I won&#39;t be back. Other local restaurants have better standards figured out and I will choose those establishments.

I was very disappointed with my lunch to go at the Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been several times in various cities and have always been disappointed with my entree. But because their cheesecake is so scrumptious, I really wanted to give them another chance after years of no patronage. Unfortunately, it was the same old story. <br><br>When I ordered on the website, they had the choice between pick up and curbside. I selected curbside, thinking it would be like any other curbside service. When I arrived, no such thing existed, so I went in to pick up my order. I paid, and the worker asked me if I wanted silverware. I said yes, and she give me a spoon. I asked for a fork but was told they were out. How does a restaurant with a to-go service have no forks?? <br><br>I ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp for $19.99. The picture online looked delicious. I also requested that there be no onions or zucchini. When I opened my lunch to eat, I immediately noticed that both were in abundant supply in the dish. This was frustrating because not only was I given the option to modify to my dish online, when I picked it up the worker confirmed out loud the modifications that apparently got missed. I was able to eat parts of the dish very carefully picking around the veg I didn&#39;t want, but it drastically affected my eating experience. I was also disappointed in the sauce. It was described online as a Thai, coconut, curry type sauce which sounded right up my alley but it didn&#39;t have much depth of flavor nor was it particularly Thai inspired. I expected a lot more for $20. <br><br>I did order a piece of cheesecake as well, which was fabulous. I guess this is just the last nail in the coffin for their savory menu. Just not their thing.

So my family and I decided to have dinner here before going to the Orpheum to see the last performance of Hamilton. Walked in at about 4:00 PM and it was really busy but we&#39;re seated pretty quickly. Our waitress was very friendly and it took a while for us to decide what to eat but we were not disappointed in anything at all. We started with the egg roll sampler and every one of those eggrolls were delicious my favorite was avocado and my son really loved the cheeseburger egg rolls. How we got the shrimp scampi with pasta and wow those shrimp were huge!! It sure filled him up. I opted for the lunch special which was a chicken almond sandwich with soup and a salad. The vinaigrette on the salad was absolutely delicious I wish I had asked what it was and also the soup had big chunks of chicken in it and it was totally out of this world. My son not being too adventurous opted for the cheeseburger sliders with fries which he said he loved. By the time we&#39;re done we had no room for dessert but we did get a slice of the Dulce De Leche cheese cake to go. I would highly suggest visiting this restaurant it was my first time but I would definitely be back they&#39;ve got a very vast menu of items I would love to try the next time we go there!!

The word that comes to mind when I think of The Cheesecake Factory is decadence.  This location does not disappoint.  I&#39;ve never had a disappointing meal here.  Some of my favorite items are the Tex Mex egg-rolls,  Steak Diane, and grilled salmon.  The last time we went we had Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake, which was so good. If you like chocolate cake more than cheesecake, try this one.  The service here is also really good and very accommodating.

Everything is yummy except the pastas- huge dish not so great on flavor. We went about 4 or 5 times so far. The service always outstanding and the food is above delicious. The salads, starters, steak, my last try was chicken and was to die for. Mouth watering cheesecake display - you can&#39;t go wrong. Great place! Try the lemon raspberry cheesecake, also the mousse chocolate or the Oreo... the red velvet is amazing too... well can&#39;t pass the cheesecake!<br><br>*Still Amazing!! (Jan/2018) <br>Food tasty incredible delicious

I love Cheesecake Factory! However, this location is all around disappointing. I visited on a Tuesday afternoon. The entire restaurant was very quiet, yet it was a 10 minute wait for us to be seated, even though almost every table was open. The hosts and manager alike all seemed very flustered and were not welcoming. Once we were seated, it took a long time for our waiter to come over. The waiter was very short with us, slow to bring us anything, and seemed upset when we asked for basic things. Though the service was bad, the food is still great! I highly recommend the fried calamari and Crispy Chicken Costelletta. Overall, the food was tasty but the staff were disappointing.

My bill was $68 and I did not tip due to slow, terrible service. My friend and I were there for almost two hours! I check my card the next day and I find a completed transaction for $76. This is fraud! I am not happy and taking money off someone&#39;s debit card without permission is illegal!

Cheesecake Factory is always on point with food. I had the shrimp appetizer. Really, really good.<br>A large group after a graduation. Could not accommodate all for sitting together(possible 2 hour wait). We chose to sit anywhere great choice, was already late in the evening.

Not really worth the money. My first issue was the seating, it was my son and I and they gave us a small table to sit at which we couldn&#39;t even eat comfortably. I don&#39;t know if they just assumed things, but when my son and I go out, we&#39;re not known for ordering just 1 dish. We like to try different things so we were limited on that but I didn&#39;t say anything about it. I was too tired from work to go through the motions. But anyways we get our food it was bland and not even hot. My son ordered ribbon pasta with sauce and it was dry as ever. I ordered fish in a light butter sauce with loaded potatoes and veggies. Fish was not seasoned or hot and the only thing that had flavor was the loaded potatoes. If i ever do eat there again Ill only be ordering cheesecake and appetizers.
Very good food. Our service was excellent. Only reason for 4 instead of 5 is for price.

We got seated right away and waiter was plesent. He made sure that my tea glass was full. He also gave us enough time with their menu as is a good sized menu.<br><br>He brought us bread as we looked at the menu.<br><br>The food came out as ordered and was fair amount of food to eat. I had enough spaghetti for two of us. The meatballs were tasty as well.<br><br>The only drawback was the price. The price for two was about thirty.dollars.

This is a fun place to grab a meal. It can be bit noisy and crowded, but that&#39;s just a result of its popularity.<br><br>They have a huge menu. It&#39;s sort of an ongoing punchline actually. It&#39;s essentially a book. On the plus side, they have something for just about every taste. That makes this a pretty agreeable place to dine as you can have a half dozen people in your party craving a half dozen different kinds of cuisine and they can all find something to eat here.<br><br>I tend to stick to either the Shepherds Pie or the Orange Chicken. I&#39;m not sure why. Both are excellent. I&#39;ve tried one or two other entrées on their menu as well, but I always come back to those two. The Avocado Egg Rolls are pretty tasty too, but incredibly rich. <br><br>Prices are a bit more than what it seems most non-regulars are expecting to pay. It&#39;s not so much because it&#39;s upscale or fine dining (though it is a nice place to dine) but a matter of supply and demand. This place does not hurt for business and so they&#39;re priced accordingly.<br><br>I&#39;ve heard from a lady that works as a trainer at a Cheesecake Factory in another city that a shockingly large amount of their food is indeed prepared from scratch each day. This is in contrast to most chain restaurants where everything seems to arrive already prepared in plastic bags.<br><br>I detest the seating. Ask for a booth and pray you get one. If you get a table you will be sitting close enough to other dining parties to literally rub elbows and when their waitperson shows up and stands between the tables to hand out food or drinks you&#39;ll have a waitperson butt in your face. At this price point I really shouldn&#39;t have to feel like a sardine in a can.<br><br>Service is usually pretty good.  I&#39;ve had great service and I&#39;ve had marginal service, but I&#39;ve never had terrible service here.<br><br>Restaurant is always very clean.

There is definitely a draw to Cheesecake Factory than every American feels. It might be the large dining space, or the expansive menu that has something for all. If not the first 2, well, it&#39;s the cheesecake! There are so many flavors it&#39;s really hard to go wrong with any of them. My personal favorite is the classic with the strawberries on top or the white chocolate raspberry. <br><br>CF suits families, casual diners, first dates/date night, pre-prom, etc. It&#39;s all American! This is the only location in Omaha/Lincoln, and I know people from Lincoln who drive to Omaha just to eat here. <br><br>Service is always pretty good as they have 1 million servers. The only negative here is that it&#39;s such a busy location that sometimes there&#39;s a wait to eat if you don&#39;t come at a good hour. Overall this is a very popular chain that has done well for many many years. It&#39;s a staple at malls across America, and we just can&#39;t seem to get enough!

Friendly staff. We were quickly seated and enjoyed prompt service by a young man named Tre. <br>Lemon Drop Martini- delicious with a sugared rim and lemon garnish. <br>Orange Chicken-generous portion size; crisp chicken and the perfect amount of orange sauce with snow peas and shredded carrot. Had to take half of it to go. <br>Fried Shrimp Platter- came with fries, tartar sauce and cocktail sauce. Good portion size. Shrimp were crisp, served hot. <br>Key Lime Cheesecake- refreshing and delicious. The Cheesecake Factory does their name justice!<br>Salted Caramel Cheesecake-rich, creamy. Perfect for caramel lovers. <br>Wonderful atmosphere, great service, and food arrived quickly and well-made. The biggest challenge is walking by the cheesecake case and having to choose!

The place is so fancy, very clean and cozy.. their foods are great though we only got appetizer and cheesecake, it&#39;s great! The price are good. The staff are very welcoming and accommodating . The location is really great too since it&#39;s next to the big mall with a huge parking space.

I can see why the &#34;Chicken Madeira&#34; is one of their specialties, because the chicken breast was the most tender and flavorful I have EVER had!  And that it was topped with mushrooms, asparagus and sauce just made this entire mouthwatering entree absolutely exceptional!!  Love, love, love!!  By the way, they also make the BEST Mojito!

The cheesecake here is AMAZING. It might be a little pricey but it is worth it. You will not regret ordering a slice, it is a humongous piece that will fill you up. The food here is good, and the servers are always joyful. It&#39;s a go to place to eat, and enjoy the atmosphere.

I went a little before 6pm and they weren&#39;t crazy busy, but they were so slow! People were even walking out because they were tired of being forgotten about. The food is great though. I got the turkey and avocado sandwich with no bacon, fries and ranch, and the Oreo  dream extreme cheesecake. It was all SO GOOD. The ranch wasn&#39;t your normal ranch, but it was delicious. And I&#39;m not a huge fan of cheesecake and loved the Oreo one. I highly recommend this restaurant if you don&#39;t mind potentially waiting awhile.

Terrible service, the food took forever to get and then tasted like it had been under the warming lights for the past half hour.<br>Dinner for 7 took 2 hours and then the waitress wanted me to pay the bill before she even brought us our dessert.<br>Complaining to the manager did nothing.<br>Needless to say we will not be going back there anytime soon!

I had the chicken mandarin.  Chicken was just right and and had the perfect flavour.<br>I have been there several times and my brother worked there for 7 years.<br>It is a great company and they have always tried to make Sure that you leave there happy if there are any issues with your experience. Make sure you share them because they will correct any error!

I have always loved The Cheesecake Factory as a franchise, visiting ones in Florida, Georgia, and a I think Missouri. All of them were superb. However, the franchise in Omaha is just lacking. I have seen other people send their food back. I usually will not send my food back but I had them mangle my orange chicken so much so that the batter was just falling off in chunks. I have gotten the chicken bellagio a couple of times, one time I could tell they turned the heat up too high while cooking and the sauce became super liquidy, my noodles looked like they were sitting in soup. My daughter got the kid&#39;s pizza once and it was over baked, a little burned underneath. My potstickers have come out over cooked, a little hard from frying too long (and I usually LOVE those potstickers). My most recent experience, we called from the mall parking lot nearby to see if there was a wait. They said there wasn&#39;t, we drive over and there is a 20+ minute wait, not a huge problem but if your toddlers are hangry I would rather have just hit the food court. There was really no need to embellish the truth on the wait, The Cheesecake Factory will always get business.. anyway, I got the chicken bellagio again, this time it was really dry with no sauce and the prosciutto tasted like it had been left out too long. Very unfortunate, I love The Cheesecake Factory anywhere else.

This is probably the saddest I have ever been at this place. I get here expecting to get my usual.. ( the snickers cheesecake)... and it&#39;s not on display. I ask the waiter if they still have the snickers cheesecake and she tells me no. I am mad and very frustrated that I&#39;m not getting my favorite cheesecake. I advise anyone that likes snicker in cheesecake form not to come here. PLEASE BRING BACK SNICKERS CHEESECAKE!!!! <br><br>Otherwise come if you like any other cheesecake. Great service thoooooo

By far the worst service I&#39;ve ever experienced. Our server, Ayla never came around to refill our drinks and we waited over 40 minutes for our slices of cheesecake to come. While we were waiting, the manager of the restaurant came by and didn&#39;t bother to apologize for the wait but instead said, &#34;At least you guys look like you&#39;re having fun.&#34; I&#39;ve gone to other Cheesecake Factory restaurants before and never experienced service this bad. I do not recommend the one at this location and will not be going back.

This used to be our favorite restaurant but honestly we are done going there. Upon entering and putting our name in the girl at front was less then friendly. Then she was rude to another couple that walked out because of her. Then my son ordered an Asian chicken dish that not only came Luke warm but halfway through eating it discovered that the chicken was raw in the middle! We Complained to our very nice server who got the manger who was apologetic and of course didn&#39;t charge for that meal. Maybe a piece of free cheesecake would have been nice as well. But the whole thing ruined our dinner. And the chicken in my salad was actually overcooked. Don&#39;t think we will be coming back which is a shame but we have repeatedly bad experiences at this location.Praying my son makes it through the night without food poisoning.
Three words...Chocolate Tower Cake absolutely delicious a bit on the rich side but delicious. The chicken samosas are so good. I also love the Kale and Quinoa Salad .

My wife and I went to the Cheesecake Factory for the first time and we were very disappointed. <br><br>We both ordered the Rennet&#39;s lunch special (I think that was the name?) she got the turkey sandwich with the default salad and I got the almond chicken salad sandwich with the Caesar Salad and we each had the soup of the day. <br><br>My almond chicken salad sandwich tasted like tuna/ranch on buttered toast- not bad tasting, but not even close to what I expected. <br><br>Her default salad had very little (watered down?) ranch and neither of us wanted it - it sucked. My Caesar salad was good, except my croutons may have been a little stale. <br><br>Our soup of the day - apparently they only have 1 soup that changes each day? Anyways, it was a mushroom based soup that tasted sweet.. some people might be into that, but I hated it (wife thought it was alright). I hate throwing away food, but I couldn&#39;t stomach it past 3 spoon fools. <br><br>I thought the food was fairly expensive for what we got, let alone the fact the food sucked.. <br><br>The ONE thing we both really enjoyed was the Cheesecake. The cheese cake lived up to the hype we heard, but even then it wasn&#39;t without issue- we got two cheese cakes with Lunch and requested 2 to go. The two brought out to the table were great and large, the two we got to go were already packed up and significantly smaller- not sure if that is their protocol or not, or if certain cheesecakes are larger than others and the two we had dinning in were two of the &#39;larger&#39; cakes and the two we got to go were &#39;smaller&#39; cakes.<br><br>Despite the cheesecake being good, we don&#39;t plan on going back, ever. <br><br>I&#39;d recommend just going for the cheesecake/desert if you go at all, but this was our only time here, so we obviously can&#39;t spell for the other menus items. <br><br>One last closing note- we had a good server.

So with limited expectations, I actually was impressed with CF. We came here for a business lunch and as went with the Cobbs Salad, I will say the chicken that was a part of it was very juicy as opposed to the usual diced cold chicken. The server also brought out a bread basket and the Diet Coke must&#39;ve been in a 32 oz cup because that thing was huge! It wasn&#39;t super busy but the hostess seemed disheveled when we asked to be moved to a different area. Regardless CF isn&#39;t my bag but for lunch, it&#39;s suitable.

We love Cheesecake Factory and visit them all over, when I travel. After 10 years away, I was delighted that Omaha now has a CF. However...<br>The table was dirty. The menus were dirty. The salt and pepper shakers were dirty. The utensils were dirty. When we asked to have our table cleaned, the hostess acted as if we were crazy. A young woman appeared and &#34;cleaned&#34; the table with a filthy rag, pushing the crumbs onto the top of the table onto the booth seats. It does no good to clean anything with a dirty rag.<br>We should have walked out, but we didn&#39;t. We were hungry and tired, so we stayed. As we left, we noticed that the front door was dirty.<br>There are too many other restaurants that ARE clean that would be happy to have our money. We will not return to Cheesecake Factory Omaha. Very disappointed.

Best part about Cheesecake Factory is the quality they maintain at every location and you can always expect to get what you are craving out of their large menu.<br>We, the business travelers, turned up here for an easy evening dinner. I had the herb roasted Lemony salmon with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus and it was yummy and creamy rich. My two other colleagues went for chicken pasta and chipotle salad and were happy. The service was quick and the server was nice and fast. We wanted to get a fast dinner and we were done in an hour which was nice.

One of our &#34;go to&#34; places!  Lots of selections for the picky eater and great atmosphere. <br><br>Bang bang chicken and shrimp is my favorite as well as Dulce de Leche cheesecake for dessert--which I highly recommend!
I Lv the food ....and service <br><br>Dejanae is the best service !!! We Lv her !!!! So kind<br><br>We gonna come back here for sure

Had the salmon salad...they give SO MUCH food and it was cooked and seasoned really well.<br>BUT the avocado rolls are OUT OF THIS WORLD!! They are SOOO DELISH!!!<br>So fresh. They give you a good helping of avocado in each roll.<br>The dipping sauce was outstanding!<br><br>I use to love this place and then it went down hill... and I gave up on chain restaurants. A friend wanted to go here... so we did. And I am glad I gave them another try... it has been about 3 or 4 years since my previous visit! They have improved. It was outstanding.<br><br>The bartender was very nice as well...

Had a celebration dinner set for Sunday night 10/28/18 with 11 people. We were aware they would not take a reservation on a Sunday so 1 of the people showed up early, they would not seat till 1/2 the party was present, when 1/2 the party was there, we were the told there was not a table for 11, they would have to seat us in 2 booths for 6. Not what we asked for or  it was a work team celebration  not separated  booths celebration. We were then told it would be a hour &amp; half wait till we could be seated for 11. Unacceptable, hostess was rude, snotty. Unbelievable. So we called across to PH Chang&#39;s who could have a table together for 11 in 10 mins. When the pager was turned in and said we would be going else where. The snotty little hostess just said ok.  So they let a $370 food table and a $100 tip walk out the door.  Bad experiences lol the way around.

Cleanliness 4<br>Service 5<br>Food 4<br>Likelihood 5<br>1-5 (5 Best!) 4.5<br><br>We we greeted by the front desk employee quickly, and seated within minutes.  Our server stopped by to greet us and get our drink order, also within minutes.  Our appitizer arrived and througout the meal our server never let either of our drinks go empty, great work!  <br><br>She was quick to help, and always a glance away.  VERY good!  Jonny does not get along with seeded buns, and the staff responded without fail to get it replaced quickly.  Thank you.  The restrooms were spotless.<br><br>She cleared our dishes and tried hard to get us dessert, we were too full.  Manager was in dining room but was not stopping by tables.  Great meal expereince.

i came to the cheesecake factory for a nice meal, which did not happen. I ordered the fettuccine alfredo, and it had a hint of fish in it. i am not pleased by the flavor. I would NOT recommend if you do not like fish.

For someplace called The Cheesecake Factory I would expect the best cheesecake I have ever had, blow your mind. It was good. But expensive!! Red velvet was a little squishy.<br>Service was decent. Stopped in for just desert. Water was brought out fairly quick. But service was not over the top either! <br>The restaurant was  clean and well kept. <br>Overall decent experience. But not what I expected!! Cheesecake was good but not the best ever!! But very good!

It is the Cheesecake Factory. What more can be said? Huge menus, huge portions, strong drinks. I recommend the pot stickers because of that wonderful sauce. They do have some lighter fare menu options for those watching calories. If you get creative, you can stick to your macros.<br><br>They even have low carb cheesecake but seriously, if you are going to fall off the wagon let it be face first into a slice of their full fat, full calorie laden, mouth watering cheesecake. Be smart, share it with a friend or two.

This place has gotten way too corporate. There are literally flat screen televisions above their cheesecake counter advertising their food and drink options. Nothing charming about that. In regards to their menu, while I appreciate  variety, their menu is just too large. It is literally 21 pages. Every time I go here I don&#39;t have the patience to go through it. Portions are massive which I am sure some people appreciate but it just isn&#39;t necessary and just perpetuates the cycle of overeating.<br>The other night I got 2 cocktails and just those drinks were $24...way too high for a restaurant chain. <br>The food is good and I always enjoy their cheesecakes  but I think they should scale it back a bit.

Always a win! I just wish it was so pricy. Why are apps the same price as a dish. Come on..but I still can&#39;t resist those firecracker salmon spring rolls. I got a curry dish was so good...minus the nuts. I don&#39;t like nuts in my meals. My daughter got her go to Cajun chicken pasta. Service was prompt and friendly

Despite preferring local restaurants, there are some chains that I really love. Unfortunately the Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t do much for me. I usually find myself here once a year or so, and the food is good, but it isn&#39;t great, and is a little pricey for what you get. Their cheesecake is very good, though. As a lot of other reviewers mentioned, the menu is huge. It is basically a giant book with any kind of food you could want (burgers, salads, wraps, pizza, Thai food, Mexican food, etc.). On the plus side, you shouldn&#39;t have any trouble finding something on the menu that you will like. It is a little overwhelming having to flip through a giant book (with excessive advertisements and photos in the middle) to look over the entire menu, though. <br><br>My husband and I went here for dinner on a weeknight. For an appetizer we ordered the Loaded Baked Potato Tots, which were served with ranch. Other than being a little too salty, these were awesome. The flavor was incredible and they were perfect dipped in the ranch. <br><br>For my entrée I went with the Barbecue Ranch Chicken Salad. The salad was huge and loaded with a large variety of toppings. The dressing was (per the name) a basic BBQ sauce and ranch dressing. The salad was good, but nothing amazing. My husband ordered the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps, which were served on a pretty impressive and large tray, and he was very satisfied with his meal. <br><br>Despite the restaurant being over half empty, we were seated at one of those long booth/table combos in which the tables are RIGHT next to each other, and there was a couple at the next table. The tables are so close that we were awkwardly close to the other people (I accidentally knocked them when I was trying to scoot in). I wouldn&#39;t have minded if the restaurant was even a little crowded, but it was really weird since it was almost empty (and the next 4 tables were completely empty). That couple left and another couple were sat at the same table (more awkwardness). Our server was friendly, but would disappear for long periods of time. We had to chase her down when we wanted to pay after we had waited 20 minutes for her to come back and she never showed. <br><br>I am sure I will end up here again in a year or so, and the food will probably be good, but it isn&#39;t someplace at which I would go out of my way to eat. I would totally go out of my way to stop in and get cheesecake from here if I was in the area (and they have a convenient counter at the front that makes it easy to do just that).

This company/management needs to learn how to manage the requests of people who want to come in for Cheesecake to go.  Being told it would take 5-10 minutes to box a slice of cheesecake when there&#39;s no line at the counter is unacceptable.

Went for Christmas lunch in omaha ,I flew in from arizona with my daughter her chicken pot pie wasCOLD,then my mushroom burger was hot but fell apart in my hands it was so greasy then my d as ughters hot pie came,which was tastless,waiter just laughed, no reduction in bill or offered complementary dessert,gone downhill even dr n in arizona

The Original style cheesecake was the main reason I came here. And have to say as a staple cheesecake it was pretty ordinary and not what I was expecting. It was good but not good enough. I found the consistency to be much more thicken than others. My favorite part was the crust of course!<br><br>Our server Doris was very nice and definitely provided quality customer service and made our dining an enjoyable experience.<br><br>Will be coming back try other cheesecakes!

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. Their complimentary bread is always enjoyable. I like going during lunch so I can get the smaller portions for a lower cost. The pastas have never failed to disappoint. I got the Cajun jambalaya and my friend got the spicy chicken chipotle pasta. Both looked amazing! Lastly the atmosphere is pretty nice however it can be a bit odd when they sit you in the row of tables that seat two each. You are sitting close enough to have a convo with the next table.

Every time I come here I enjoy myself for the most part. The food is good and the cocktails are made to perfection. This past weekend I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta which tasted amazing!!! For drinks I ordered a Mimosa which was just ok, and a Typhoon Punch which was the order WINNER! Now every time I come to The Cheesecake Factory, I will have to make sure that the Typhoon Punch is part of my order!

So far been sitting a while waiting for our host...place isn&#39;t too busy must not communicate well.  Now they are bussing a table ... three more walked by all talking to each other and Im still sitting here oh she finally stopped couldn&#39;t hear a word she said ... &#34;blah blah blah&#34; this place needs an adult around to manage all these kids. <br><br>We sat where there were 6 spots only needed three they took the extra silverware after I touched it then she touched it and put it back in with the clean silverware and I just witnessed another waiter grabbing said silverware and putting it on table next to us.... and I just had my hand down my pants<br><br>Im 37 years old and never tasted tea that tasted like sweat tea that wasn&#39;t... then my tea sat there empty my girls half way empty they filled hers and left mine.... not sure am I jinxing myself because I yelp  <br><br>not impressed

For the longest time, I resisted going to the Cheesecake Factory even though my wife had been after me to take her there. I thought it was going to be one of those &#34;chick places&#34; that serves soups, salads, small sandwiches, and desserts (emphasis on the latter). I finally gave in and took her there. Boy was I wrong about this place! The food is incredible, reasonably priced, and the portions are definitely man-sized. The service was actually pretty good considering that it was a Saturday evening and the place was packed. <br><br>If I had any complaint at all about the Cheesecake Factory, it would be that the business it gets would easily support the opening of another location in Omaha. And while we&#39;re at it, let&#39;s put one in Lincoln too. You&#39;d never get me out of the place!
Amazing service! The hostesses sat us right away. We ordered and not ten minutes passed by before we were served. It&#39;s a clean, fast moving restaurant. My wife and I had a great time.

If you love a huge variety of cheesecake this is definitely the place for you. If you get overwhelmed by large menus, stick the the cheesecake. Their menu is so absolutely huge it&#39;s ridiculous and almost impossible to pick any one thing from it. <br><br>On our visit today, we were seated almost as soon as we walked in the door(on a Saturday) and our waitress came shortly after we sat down. She was extremely pleasant and courteous and we got our cheesecakes fairly quickly, considering the bakery had just seen a huge rush. <br><br>Overall, I was satisfied with the food as well as the service!

Upon entering establishment, the lady at the front had to lower her nose to ask us how many people. After being seated, we noticed the majority of our silverware was dirty! Disgusting! Waitress promptly brought us &#34;cleaner&#34; silverware. Food was sub par for the price.

I went to the Cheesecake Factory a few nights ago with my mother and girlfriend. So here is how this went down. We only had to wait about 15 minutes before the buzzer went off and we were seated. No complaints there. The waiter then took our order and disappeared into the kitchen. About 15 minutes went by and no food came; however the waiter came back twice to let us know it was a busy night and to thank us for being patient. Cool. After another 5 minutes or so the manager came by to appologize and thank us for our patience and let us know our food was on our way. Usually I would have an issue with the length of time it took to get our food; however the manager and his staff were rather engaged with us about it so I did not take issue. <br><br>Next, My and my gf&#39;s dinner was fine. Mac-n-Cheese burger was absolutely delicious. Properly cooked and fantastic. My gf&#39;s Chicken Bellagio was also fantastic. Properly cooked and the noodles were done just right. However, my mother&#39;s Mushroom burger was a disaster. The saute&#39;d mushrooms were so crispy you would have thought they were fried. The burger was so over done, you would have thought you were at a military &#34;burger burn&#34; fundraiser. She choked through half of it before I told her she needed to bring it to the waiter&#39;s attention. Once the waiter came back; she spoke to him about it. He immediately apologized and said that he would go get the manager for us.  Once the manager came, he looked at what was on my mother&#39;s plate and said he would get a new one out for her immediately and apologized profusely. The manager was very professional. Now, we are not the type of people that get &#34;screamy&#34; and &#34;yelly&#34; when things go wrong. Mistakes happen. So goes life. So, the manager asked us what he could do to fix the issue, my mother said she just wanted a properly cooked meal and would leave that decision up to the manager. The manager stated he would get her a properly cooked meal ASAP and he would also comp the meal for the inconvenience. About 8 minutes later, a properly cooked Mushroom burger arrived and it was &#34;excellent&#34; according to my mother. Cool. 3 out of 3 great meals. Cool. <br><br>Then came dessert. Plain Cheesecake and Pumpkin Pecan Cheesecake. &#34;Oh Em Gee&#34; was it delicious. The Pumpkin Pecan is definitely dangerous. Not overly sweet; but very addictive. Sadly it is &#34;seasonal&#34;. <br><br>So all in all; the food was good, and management did great in correcting a poorly cooked meal. All things said and done; I have no qualms about going back. I can definitely say that if I a mistake happens in the kitchen-I know it will be corrected promptly. Mistakes happen; and the manager knows how to fix them. A definite recommend.

Service on a Saturday afternoon was horrible, it took almost 10 minutes before we met our waitress. Nice gal, just slow. The food was ok, my wife ordered the lettuce tacos with chicken,  only 2 of the three had chicken in them. I of course ordered the margarita pizza which was surprisingly good. It had the right flavor and look, but the crust was more of a cracker crust rather than the pizza crust I&#39;d expect. We didn&#39;t want to spend the whole afternoon there so we paid for our food, then grabbed a cheesecake to go. Which of course was amazing. Would I go again for meal, maybe.
Yum yum in my tum tum!! Shared a nice Oreo cheesecake slice with my husband paired with a glass of white wine. Would like to go back and see what other foods they offer.

We were seated immediately about 1 foot away from other customers on each side which was an uncomfortable start especially considering the restaurant was not very busy. The food was good but our server was AWOL most of the time.

Boy oh boy do we need another location in town. We decided to get carry out last night and the Bakery/carry out counter was completely overwhelmed. We were told 30 mins for food, in actuality it was 45 minutes. It would have been longer but we spotted our food being shuffled onto a shelf and ignored, had we not asked about it we would&#39;ve ended up like the guy before us who was ignored for ten minutes while his food got cold. The carry out window forgot our dessert and had us stand and wait for it as they shuffled through piles of tickets looking to see if we had actually paid for it. When they finally bagged it we were told they were out of napkins and silverware.<br><br>The other issue is the food quality which has been steadily declining as of late. On our last visit we received burned carbonara and the waitress balked at replacing it, the visit before that I received chicken that was undercooked. Last night the asparagus side was inedible, overcooked, and an off color. They also seem to have changed their once delicious carrot cake to a flavorless slice of mediocrity that is 2/3 the size it was previously. <br><br>I recommend visiting a place that values their customers a little more highly to satisfy your sweet tooth at least until they sort out their management and food quality issues.

It was the third time today to try Cheesecake Factory since we moved to Omaha.<br>Service: Servers are always smiling and welcoming, good listeners and decisive when asked for recommendations, although specifically as for tonight, the side dish of appetizer was forgotten.<br>Food: Highly recommend the Crispy Crab Bites and Fish Taco, of course, the Mousse Chocolate Cheesecake -- foogasm-awesome, everybody should eat it~! Buffalo Chicken Strips were too salty... I mean, salty-my-ass-off kinda salty, yet the Shrimp Angel Hair was a little bit too bland.

cheesecake factory used to have some great quality but not sure what has happened. <br><br>someone please fix the curb side pick-up. on multiple occasions we have not gotten our complete order. when I called mgmt, I was told a gift card would be sent for inconvenience, but I never received. <br><br>most recently we had side dishes missing with horribly charred salmon. where is the quality control? <br><br>I feel like the corporate vibe now is get people in and out. the hell with quality control. <br><br>well, I&#39;ll just go elsewhere local!

Great food &amp; drinks. Servers are very nice. Would have given 5 stars, the wait on a Saturday is very - very long!  The friendly staff make it tolerable. Highly recommend. Be ready for a very long wait for food if they are busy!

After wanting to come to the Cheesecake Factory for a while now and just reading lots of reviews, I have changed my mind. First of all your Menu is way to big for everything to be exceptional. I always wonder how everything stays fresh with so many options. I&#39;ve read lots of these reviews and replies seem so generic and not very sincere. With quality cheesecakes, which to you from outside sources, your food should be held to higher standards as well. Sorry I will not be patronizing your restaurant. Sad.

Only the service and interior gets the star but was not for the silver wears, food nor drinks.<br><br>Wild mushroom soup tasted really wild!<br><br>It tasted like they use the mushrooms that&#39;s been in the fridge for longer than 3 days and they just picked the mushrooms out there and use it for the soup I ordered without washing them at all.<br><br>Pizza tasted like nothing but salami. (Why!?lol)<br><br>Pasta was blunt... Disappointing event for my birthday...

Probably shouldn&#39;t sign up with a delivery service unless your staff can handle it. I mean, at the least, don&#39;t lie to the poor delivery dude that you called regarding being out of an ordered item when no such call was made. Passing the buck to another underpaid service worker instead of letting your customer know is weak. I&#39;ll be sure to enjoy the third of the meal that was actually delivered.

If I could give this experience negative stars I would.  What horrible service and rude responses from a restaurant that is suppose to be known for just the opposite.  I placed a curbside order here today for a full cheesecake and an appetizer with curbside pickup.  They asked my vehicle type and color.  I had a choice of pickup or curbside.  Curbside means they bring it to your car, correct?  Not here.  I pulled up and waited for anyone to come to the car or acknowledge my presence.  I looked around at the sign.  Was there a phone number to call or some other way I was suppose to let them know I was here?  Nothing on the sign said so.  I had to assume that the service of a place like this would have a system worked out such as Outback Steakhouse does where they watch for people who pull up, come out and verify your name and bring the food to you.  Or perhaps their service would at the minimum match a Walmart pick up where they know you are coming and if they don&#39;t know you are there through their app, they have a phone number on the sign that tells you who to call.  But no, not cheesecake factory.  I wait assuming that curbside meant curbside.  If I had wanted to get out and go inside I would have chosen pickup.  So, after about 8 minutes I go inside and ask about my order.  They say I had to go over and stand in the Pick up area which is the same place people pick up cheesecakes.  There is always a line there, that is what I was trying to avoid.  When I asked what I should have done to get them to have brought my food out, they said I should have called.  Called who?  There was no number posted anywhere.  I said that and as I walked away the person who seats customers whispered under her breath &#34;God all she had to do was call the cheesecake factory&#34;.  Are you kidding?  No service and rude behavior! So, over to stand in a line I shouldn&#39;t have had to stand in and, 20 minutes later than when I pulled up, I was back in my car.  I left and went up eat the appetizer I had bought for my lunch.  Cold crab cake bites.  They obviously had made no effort to keep them warm as they were room temperature at best.  I had already left the parking lot, that is in the middle of construction, so I had to go all the way around, park and go back inside.  Talked to the front person who said she couldn&#39;t do anything, got back into the cheesecake line.  Not a separate like- just an area where people are usually buying cheesecake.  After waiting for the 4 parties ahead of me get their cheesecake, I got to a very frazzled girl who was running that area alone, even through there were 3-4 waitresses standing at the end taking.  She took the cold crab bites telling me a manager would be over.  After another 5-8 minutes I got what must have been a new manager as he said it was his first time doing a refund and he didn&#39;t know how.  Most restaurants would try to apologize and do something to make up for my almost 30 minutes of messing with this at this point but no - not here.  I actually had to say is that all you&#39;re going to do about this?  Refund the $8 I paid for cold food?  In any other restaurant they would have tried to do something to save my business but that was obviously not the case here.  After ASKING if that was all they were doing the manager said I guess I could give you a piece of cheesecake.  Wow - what horrible service on every level.

This was my worst experience at a Cheesecake Factory. The hostess told us our wait would only be 5 minutes but we ended up waiting over 25 minutes. She said this is because some of the waiters showed up late. Our food took forever to get and once we got it, there were several mistakes with our orders. In total, we were at the restaurant for over 2 hours because of the slow service. The only reason I gave this review one star was because the cheesecake tasted good at the end. I will not return.

I love the Cheesecake Factory and up until a few weeks ago I had nothing but great experiences there. However, the last time I went we had a terrible waitress. She was rude, sarcastic, and inconsiderate. I ended up calling and telling the manager - something I never do. The manager was great. She apologized and made it right. She was so nice and didn&#39;t make me feel like *that* annoying, whiny customer. I really appreciated her response. Five stars.

Our waiter Matt was a slow as snail. The food was ok but had to be delivered by a food runner that generally means its sat there long enough because Matt the snail never made it back to the kitchen so someone else had to do his job. Our drinks and waters were empty when the food arrived and since Matt never checked on us they sat empty until dinner was almost over. My wife ordered a glass of wine that never showed up so I decided to ask for a manager when he picked up our plates and asked if we needed anything else. We waited for the manager she didnt show, so we tracked down matt at the bar and asked him to make it right... he didnt and handed us the bill....he did remove the glass of wine we never recieved.....nice guy!!<br>On my way up to find a manager she finally showed with little to no apology and was less than accommodating. Never even got to order cheese cake didnt want our hour and a half dinner to take any longer.

I&#39;ve been to a lot of Cheesecake Factory locations across the US and normally come here because of the chain&#39;s consistency. I came here rather than Granite City because normally everything you order on the menu is good and the service is excellent. While the service was as expected, the Santa Fe Salad I normally order at lunch wasn&#39;t at par with normalcy. Locating any chicken in the salad was a chore. Normally, there&#39;s so much you can&#39;t eat it all. This time I felt like I was on a quest to find it. The same went for the black beans.<br><br>Meanwhile, every meal that passed by me to other tables looked great and I saw dozens of them. Unfortunately, mine was that fell short. Still, this is a great place for lunch or dinner and of course dessert. Wonderful service and a menu that gives you so many great choices it&#39;ll be a challenge to choose something.

What can go wrong at the cheesecake factory?  Other than the fact that they discontinued my ultimate favorite cheesecake, the Kahlua cocoa coffee cheesecake, everything else they make is pretty darn good.  Service is also great, waiters and waitresses come by often to check on you and make sure everything tastes great and waters are filled.  I love coming to their happy hour and enjoying their avocado egg rolls.  The menu is enormous so it&#39;s usually hard for me to decide what I want.  What I do love is the Godiva chocolate brownie sundae.  The presentation is gorgeous you almost don&#39;t want to eat it.  But once you do it&#39;s over!  You&#39;ve got dollops of ice cream with whipped cream on top, three pieces of warm brownie lined in between the ice cream and godiva chocolates nestled in the whipped cream to top it off!  It&#39;s pretty amazing I wish I could be eating one right now!  Other than their amazing desserts they also have great alcoholic drinks and I&#39;ve always loved their garlic pasta with chicken dish too.  Like I said, what can go wrong here other than taking away an amazing cheesecake?

$20 for fettuccine alfredo and it wasnt worth it. It was good, but too expensive. Service was great and we were in and out in an hour. I&#39;ll still come back, but will probably order something thats worth $20.

I am always hearing how good their food is, and how big their slices of cheesecake are, but honestly? I can make a cheesecake myself for far less. My husband and I received a gift card for Christmas and decided to do car side to go, I was on hold for 15 min and then waited another 15 min for my 3 slices of cheesecake to be ready. I went inside just to get it done with, it was so full in there and the employees looked frantic and run down. <br>If you like loud, over-crowded, over-expensive, chain restaurants, then this is the place for you. I prefer local places.

Came here a few days ago on a date night with hubby, we dont plan on coming back, except maybe for some cheesecake for carry out. <br><br>We walked in and were seated right away but we were sat at a half booth half table that barely fit anything on the table it was so tiny! We were practically touching elbows with the people at the table next to us. I&#39;m talking so close we would get wiffs of their breath. It made me nauseous. <br><br>The server came and got our drink order. When she came back with our drinks we ordered the &#34;fried cheese&#34; for an appetizer. It took quite a while for our appetizer to come out but we are pretty patient so we brushed it off and placed our dinner order when she brought it out. I was not a fan at all. It was fried mozzarella and asiago (I think?) but it tasted really weird, kind of like a loaded baked potato or something. The cheese could have been melted a bit more too.<br><br>We sat and talked, waiting for probably a good 30 to 45 minutes for our food to come out. I noticed a chunk of food on our silverware that we hadn&#39;t yet used. Hubby said how his silverware felt greasy and his menu was too. <br><br>Finally the food came out. I got fish and chips like the last time we came here, but it didn&#39;t look very tasty like I had remembered. They also raised the price to $17.99. I tried the fries, they were good. What you would expect. I didn&#39;t even try the slaw, just not my thing. Then there&#39;s the fish. The star, what I was so excited for. It was bland, and WAY overbattered! I couldn&#39;t get a good picture because of the dark lighting but honestly it was like 25% fish and 75% batter. I&#39;m not even kidding. I had to pull off most of the breading to even see or taste fish. The fish was extremely small and thin and over cooked. Some pieces were hard to chew. Tartar sauce was good though.. This meal was not worth the price at all. I felt completely ripped off.<br>Hubby got a burger of some sort that he thought was pretty good, nothing special though. He said they barely put any mushrooms on it and they charged us $2 for a slice of cheese.<br><br>We were frustrated with the whole situation and just wanted to leave. We waited for a good 10 minutes before our server came and took our food to be boxed up and give us our check. I only ate a few fries and a single torn up piece of fish. Hubby only had about half of his burger. I really wanted to get a slice of cheesecake but I had just witnessed the table next to us wait for 15 or 20 minutes for some, so no thanks. I didn&#39;t think about it until writing this review but with so little food eaten on our plates you would think they would ask if we didn&#39;t like our food but they didn&#39;t. We arent ones to complain and we had things we had to go do. I was so excited to come back but left disappointed. The service was fine but scarce, and the food was extremely unpleasant in my case. I left just as hungry as when I showed up and even went to the gas station on the way to run errands to get a slushie and a snack just to not feel famished! I think it&#39;s safe to say we wont be returning or at least to this location.

I usually avoid chain restaurants, but today was my Mother&#39;s 80th Birthday and she chose to go here this evening. The first observation is the 80&#39;s Eclectic Hollywood, Miami Vice Don Johnson, interior décor, with a wall of Mordor&#39;s evil eyes staring at you. Quaint. Next observation was our great server Mandi. She answered all our questions, gave advice, told to get this instead of that, a very nice<br> personality. I was going to get the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, but she suggested the Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo instead (she was from NOLA area, yet a-third Italian) It was very well presented and not too overwhelming seasoning that I have had in other restaurants who try to make Cajun foods. My mother liked her Angel Hair Shrimp (she is pretty picky). My brother and mother split the Original Cheesecake for dessert and they said it was the best they have ever had. While others got a Sunday which was the real thing. I might even go back for some other dishes. Maybe. I was good though for a chain.

Really wish I could give no stars. We have eaten at cheesecake factory in Omaha Des Moines to Kansas City. It&#39;s one of our favorite places to eat. I always have the same thing. I have the lemon chicken and mashed potatoes. Tonight we were at the cheesecake factory in Omaha and the food was disgusting. My chicken was barely cooked and my mashed potatoes were cold. The server was overzealous in our face most of the evening. It was an unusually poor dinner. Doubt will go back to eat there again.

Although, I usually like to support small local businesses, I&#39;ve always been a fan of the Cheesecake Factory. I love that they&#39;ve revamped their menu and have a separate &#34;Skinnylicuous&#34; menu; an easier way to control your portion sizes, all salads and entrees are under 600 calories. I ordered the Skinnylicuous Grilled Steak Medallions which were excellent! The meal was more than substantial and absolutely delicious! I also ordered the Red Sangria, which is listed at just 150 calories per glass. I love that I was able to eat out with a friend without feeling guilty after. The regular menu is hugely extensive and a little overwhelming. Sticking to the Skinnylicuous menu helped make my decisions much easier. <br><br>I noticed on my way in that they have happy hour Monday-Friday 4-6pm, so I will definitely be coming back to check that out!
Who doesn&#39;t love cheesecake and good food? My favorite restaurant in Omaha. Peanut butter cup cheesecake is my favorite.

The Cheesecake Factory, the place we usually go after dinner somewhere else to get a wonderful slice of cheesecake.  Never had I actually eaten a meal at a Cheesecake Factory until recently, when my son chose this as his birthday dinner spot.  We rolled in fairly early on a Friday evening and were greeted and seated right away.  <br><br>To start off, we went with a couple of appetizers: a cheese garlic bread and the chicken pot stickers.  The kids enjoyed the pot stickers but the appetizer only came with five pot stickers.  This is actually a pet peeve of mine (kinda, mostly just an observation).  I cannot for the life of me figure out why restaurants serve five items on an appetizer.  Why five?  It&#39;s an odd number and the only way it really works is if you have five people in your party and really, how often does that happen? If it&#39;s a couple, the fifth one sits there until someone decides they want to be the selfish one to eat the last one.  If you have a party of three, someone loses out!  Party of four, again, one extra sitting there until whomever takes it.  Let&#39;s go with six next time, a nice round number!  It works much better.  Party of two, three a piece.  Party of three, two a piece.  Party of four, one a piece and evenly split the last two.  See how nice that works for most parties?  <br><br>Anyway, sorry, back on track. The garlic cheese bread was very good.  The star of the meal, as it turns out.  For meals, my youngest son went with the kids sliders, which he took one bite of and wouldn&#39;t eat anymore.  This kid LOVES burgers, so it tells you how these tasted.  I tried it and agreed.  Not good.  The birthday boy went with the bacon cheeseburger, which was pretty good.  My wife ordered chicken fettuccine alfredo and was OK with it.  I did the catfish dinner, which came with mashed potatoes and green beans.  It was all fine but nothing stood out honestly.  <br><br>The service was good.  Our server brought my son a little dessert for his birthday without doing the whole singing thing.  He just turned into a teenager, so we appreciated her discretion on the singing thing because well, he&#39;s 13 and who knows how that would have gone down.  <br><br>I am torn between two and three stars overall.  The service was good (a 4 star experience) but the food left a lot to be desired.  When you spend a good chunk of money, you&#39;d like to feel like it was a treat, you know?  Something that was memorable and worth the money.  We didn&#39;t feel that here.  It just was an overpriced, underwhelming food experience.  I&#39;m not one of those crazy anti-chain Yelpers who detests all things chain but in this case, I can honestly say that Cheesecake Factory is a place to which I won&#39;t return for a meal.  Look for me ordering some cheesecake to go.

Back in August I was visiting Omaha and was in the mood for some good food. Stopped here for lunch and tried the shrimp scampi. Huge portion, lots of flavor and plenty of shrimp. This is one of my favorite dishes and the Cheesecake Factory did a great job. Took home the tiramisu cheesecake and it was heaven.

Obviously the cheesecake is bomb...(at $7.95 a slice it should be) but honestly, I won&#39;t be back. The food is OK, nothing to boast about and the prices are higher than any other comparable restaurant. The service is sooooo slow. It took us 2 hours for lunch. The only stand out part of this review and I wish I had her name, was the server who cared my son was getting upset because he was starving and our food was taking forever after we waited 20 min to get seated. She wasn&#39;t even my server and saw him starting to fuss and brought over a &#34;baby plate&#34; which was bananas and bread. It did the trick, so thank you for caring!

So my kids come in 1 hour before our meeting because they don&#39;t do reservations of any kind ?? Really wow it is supposed to be high end restaurant.  No there are 9 of us so big party , they gave away our table to somebody else and guess what they could not accommodate our party so now it&#39;s almost 8pm and we are still standing waiting for management to apologize. I am not coming back to this place again!! Bye

This has been one of our favorite restaurants and had been there multiple times in the past. But our last dinner about a week ago (on a Friday evening) was not a very pleasant experience. We went early knowing its gonna be crowded and were there before most people came. We were told to wait for about 15 mins and so we did. 30 mins after with 4-5 families of the same # of people seated already that came after us, we were still waiting.. So finally I went and ask and &#34;SURPRISE!!!!&#34;, we werent even on the list! Whats worse was they seemed irritated by me trying to get us a table. Those people working at the reception area shouldnt be doing it if they cant handle the job well and let alone made the customers feel unwelcomed. A simple sorry would have made it up already but nope. Luckily our server was very pleasant and made the whole dinner bearable.

Had the cheesecake factory for the very first time. I will have to say the food is okay.... they give u a lot food but not what I expected as in price. I&#39;m not a cheap person but it&#39;s a very pricey restaurant.

Date night last Saturday! No matter what time you go, expect to wait at least 30 minutes. We got there between 4:30-5 pm and it was still a full dinner rush. It&#39;s worth the wait, though! Our server, Brandon P., provided excellent service!! The guacamole appetizer (made spicy) is the BEST GUACOMOLE! I have said before it is the best guacamole in the world ;-) Not necessary what you think of at the Cheesecake Factory, but it is absolutely delicious.  Oddly enough, I&#39;m giving it only 4 stars because I haven&#39;t found a cheesecake I like yet. I generally love cheesecake at any other restaurant, but I haven&#39;t found one here that I have enjoyed enough to finish or take home. I realize I&#39;m probably the odd one out by saying that... I&#39;ll keep trying!

Love this place. As others stated a little on the expensive side but the portions you get are massive. <br><br>The have the best chicken strips and ranch dressing around.  I would definitely recommend you save room for dessert because their cheesecake is divine!

I&#39;d take a pic to show you what they think fettuccine Alfredo looks like,  butter on pasta.  My phones storage is full so I can&#39;t.  That is NOT fettuccine. That&#39;s not fettuccine  at all. Fettuccine isn&#39;t butter sauce it&#39;s a cheese sauce.  It&#39;s white and thick not thin and yellow.  I don&#39;t like having to repeat myself to a snot nosed server.  I shouldn&#39;t have to even ask to talk to manager they should know to come when I&#39;m distraught.  I don&#39;t dress like a pauper.  I definitely dress to impress and I certainly wasn&#39;t impressed.  I expect a little consistency when I go out.  I can go to the mall and get half priced kids meals at the Flagship commons and it&#39;s more than enough food and I don&#39;t have to TIP some kid who has no pride in his work.  That&#39;s what I recommend.  This place is lame.  The only reason I tried it out is because they make it look so yummy on the Big Bang Theory.  FALSE ADVERTISING!  GERMS ON THE SILVERWARE.  Here&#39;s a pro tip,  just give the dessert when you mess up.  I shouldn&#39;t have to ask.  Your fettuccine isn&#39;t even cheese it&#39;s butter I thought you were the cheese cake factory.  RECOGNIZE public officials as well.  We aren&#39;t paid enough to be ignored.  Dave and Busters keeps us swimming in fringe benefits.  You don&#39;t.

This was my first time here at cheesecake factory in Omaha, and I have to say it was great! Although I didn&#39;t have any room for dessert, I&#39;d have to come back on empty stomach so I can fill up and try their cheesecakes. The ambiance and atmosphere was nice and calm but it gets a little hectic with the waiting list after 7 pm which is normal but all in all it was good experience. Friendly waitresses and staff.

We were on vacation in Omaha and had just come back from the zoo. There is no Cheesecake Factory where we live, and we were skeptical going due to some of the reviews, but we decided to give it a shot. It was a busy Saturday night, and I knew they&#39;d be busy and I wasn&#39;t expecting 5 star service. But I was expecting better than what we got. First off, the server forgot our sons drink but brought ours out. We had to ask him twice to bring our sons juice out. Biggest rule when there&#39;s kids at the table...take care of the kids first. We as adults can wait, but my 3 year old luckily had just taken a nap and didn&#39;t freak out too much. We waited about 10-15 mins from the time we sat down to the time we finally got our sons drink. He was drinking my water while we waited. But our server seemed busy so I cut him some slack. Then my son said he wanted pizza. He was hungry, so this is where he started losing patience. We asked the server to get our sons order in right away while we looked at the menu. We also ordered our appetizer at the same time. We had some questions about the menu that our server had no answer to. Granted it is a big menu, and I think he must have been new-ish. But I feel like he kind of just made up answers to our questions because he wasn&#39;t willing to find out the correct answer. I couldn&#39;t decide between the shrimp scampi or the Jamaican blackened shrimp. Server recommended the Jamaican shrimp so I ordered that. My husband got the Cajun pasta. Our app finally came out...no kids pizza with the app like we had asked. Our son was asking about his pizza because we had our appetizer. I thought maybe the pizza took longer than our app, but surely thought it&#39;d be out before our food. 15 mins later, our food comes. No pizza. At this point our son looks confused because we have our food and he doesn&#39;t have his. We thought the server forgot, but 2 mins later the server brought his pizza out. Luckily our food came out pretty quickly for how busy they were (15-18 mins I&#39;d say) so we didn&#39;t even mention it. Our son was just happy to have his food. Now I try my food...not impressed. The dish I got wasn&#39;t terrible, but it just wasn&#39;t what I was hoping for. Maybe it&#39;s my fault for going out of my comfort zone, but I wouldn&#39;t recommend it. It just didn&#39;t leave me satisfied. It was OK. Should have gone with the shrimp scampi!! Husband said his was okay too but he wished he had gone for the steak like he originally wanted. But we thought a 10oz ribeye was going to be a bit too small. It actually seemed like a decent size from what we saw. Then dessert. Server brought us the wrong cheesecake. Fixed it right away tho. Bill came, 100$. Now we were fully expecting to spend 100$ at least! But the service we received (and the food somewhat) was NOT up to par for a 100$ meal. Maybe if we had a more experienced server this review would&#39;ve been much different. Maybe they could have recommended a better dish, and had all the answers to our questions. Maybe they would&#39;ve remembered our sons drink and maybe his food would have been correctly rung in so it came out first. Either way, would I go back? Probably. I&#39;d like to try something else on their menu. And I&#39;m all about second chances. But don&#39;t expect top notch service or food here based on my experience. I feel like it&#39;s probably hit or miss here and a lot of it depends on who your server is. That&#39;s how it is at a lot of places and that&#39;s why I still gave it 3 stars. The 2 stars knocked off are for the mistake with my sons food and drink (kids should always be a priority) and the other star is for the food and the fact that I left feeling completely unsatisfied. Edit to add: our server also did not bring us bread. We didn&#39;t know we were able to get bread until we saw tables around us with it. Halfway thru our visit we asked for bread and received some. Also, he was not on top of refills.

Well here&#39;s my breakdown 1st...<br>Our Waitress...5<br>Food...............2<br>Cleanliness.....3.5 (My arm found some sticky who knows what jiz it was and the Salt &amp; Pepper shakers were sticky and the pepper had the salt top on it. Couldn&#39;t shake pepper out with a jackhammer!)<br>Seating..........3.5 (Tried to sit us in one of those &#34;I can&#39;t move my arms because the table next to me is against me&#34; tables. What idiot thought up that kind of seating? Who wants somebody you don&#39;t know with their snot dripping kid sitting next to them trying to play with stuff from the other table while the worthless parents pay no attention to them! Seriously people...SPREAD OUT!!! If I wanted to eat with stinky people next to, I would have joined a COMMUNE!<br><br>But seriously, our waitress was spot on! Always kept checking on us. Kept the drinks flowing and was most helpful on the menu after we had to sort through the AD&#39;S! What the....AD&#39;s in the menu? What is wrong with you GOOFBALLS? I was ready to jerk each page out with an ad for some other company. What a shill!
