But the back of the house dropped the ball.<br><br>Overall experience was probably a 3.5 or so, but the food quickly brought that number crashing down, hence the 2 star!<br><br>If it was all based solely on our Waitress, then I would have given the place a 5 star!

I have tried to eat out on the patio the last two weeks but it was close both times. Today the temperature was 90. When asked the receptionist said patio will be closed the rest of the year. Does not make any sense the season to eat out is limited in Nebraska. The only good thing is I do have options from competitors.

Arrived and was seated almost immediately. There were ten tables seated upon arrival. We waited 15 minutes with no greeting until we finally went to the hostess stand and was told, &#34;I have no idea who your server is, I have to look.&#34;<br>We watched the waitress next to us argue that she wasn&#39;t taking our table of nine even though it was hers. We watched two other servers close to the bar pass is by and not greet us. 22 minutes later and no bread, no water, no greeting. The manager was slinking along the bar pointing at us and finally found someone to come over. This waitress came over and immediately said, &#34;I&#39;m<br>Not your server but no one knows who is, so I&#39;m going to take your drinks.&#34;<br>We asked for bread and kids meals and then she was gone. When our drinks were ready, the waitress that&#39;s wasn&#39;t our waitress sat them on a table nearby and left. We got up and helped ourselves to our tray of drinks. When we needed refills, we got up ourselves and ordered at the bar. <br>No manager came over to apologize for lack of service or failure of anyone to take responsibility for the table. Nine people that were treated like they were not wanted. We finally were served by the waitress that had been arguing that she didn&#39;t want our table. Terrible! It took us almost two hours for appetizers and lunch specials!

the cheesecake is amazing. And we are still trying to make it as good back in Croatia. But I don&#39;t see that happening anytime soon. I had the most amazing server at this restaurant and this at is the only reason I keep coming back and of course the Cheesacake. I am not from Omaha but I am sure this location is not in the ghetto and I believe the prices are reasonable.

First visit here and it was great. Friday night and the place was packed. We were seated right away on the patio. I started off with a pineapple Moscow mule. Very tasty indeed! Got the fried mac and cheese burger. Cooked exactly as I requested. It was an awesome burger. Finished off with the tiramisu. I will be back for another run at that dessert menu.

This place really needs an update. While I still enjoy the food and service the atmosphere has not changed since 2004. This place use to be the go to for my family but it no longer is because the place needs an update.

We was very excited to try out Cheesecake Factory, everyone has always told us how great it was.  So after we walked to our table at snail speed because the floor was so greasy I was afraid my wife would slip and fall. I say greasy because I have experienced that slick feeling before in a restaurant and it was a KFC and an employee accidentally mopped the floor with water they had cleaned around the fryer. Very dangerous. Then we met a very nice waitress who handed us a menu with massive amount of choices to choose from. After discussing options with our waitress we had made our selections. I chose the chicken parm  pizza style with angel hair pasta in anAlfredo cream sauce. Very excited one of my most favorite meals at many other eateries. My wife chose the orange chicken and rice. When our meal arrived it looked like a flattened out piece of chicken smothered in microwaved mozzarella cheese and on top was a pile of pasta with no sauce on it. The chicken was not with a crisp crust but soggy and I had to add salt to the dish to eat my 5 bites.  Not good. My wife&#39;s orange chicken looked delicious so I tried a piece because she wasn&#39;t eating anything but the rice (how can you mess up white rice) the chicken flavor was that of a piece of chicken covered in what tasted like a sweet donut batter . So know I know why she only ate the rice. I have a few suggestions for what seemed to be very nice restaurant, chill on the selections of food and focus on making less choices delicious and please clean your floors before someone slips and hurts themselves. The waitress was very very nice. This place needs some leadership that will focus on quality and absolutely needs to put an end to whoever cleans the floors it was bad.

Honestly I just do not get the Cheesecake Factory.  I have been to a few over the years and the food is just mediocre at best and the menu is so big it is overwhelming.  This particular experience was a Friday during Lent so no meat.  My daughter and I ordered a pasta dish that was supposed to have lightly breaded shrimp.  Well the shrimp had no breading and was extremely over cooked and tough.  Then we found the breading, little balls of gooey breading in the pasta (but not on the shrimp!)  YUCK.  My other daughter ordered fish and chips -- GREASY!!!
Next time maybe the manager could stop by during the 1:20 minutes we spend there. Clearly a future visit is highly important to this location

My food was delicious (chicken and biscuits) and I tried the Tex Mex egg rolls for the first time. My usual favorite is the avocado egg roll appetizer which are wonderful for any avocado lover. This restaurant is a place I frequent. I usually don&#39;t have any problems, but most recently one of our orders was not entered into the system. He was served late but the manager compensated that meal-- which made everyone happy. I would recommend this place to anyone!

Arrived 6:45pm. Left at 9:10pm. Never got seated nor fed. The manager never came by to apologize the hostess was extremely rude. The bartenders were the only thing good about the night. They apologized and allowed me to at least order for my kids. They need to be the managers. We also called in advanced to let them know we were coming since we did have a party of twelve. Never offered for us to split up to be seated faster or anything. Very disappointed. I don&#39;t know if I could ever bring myself to go back. My friends stayed but I had children so I had to leave. I guess you can say this is not a kid friendly place at all.

I love this restaurant. The food is always great and the service is good. My favorite dish is the stuffed chicken tortillas and key lime cheesecake. <br>I really wanted to write in because I ate there again today and it reminded me of the last time there and I watched the manager apologize to a table for like 20 minutes to a table of 12 some people and they were so rude. So I remembered and wanted to say thank you and remember not everyone is as rude as some of these people I&#39;m sure you have to deal with. <br>Keep up the good work!

Service could of been a little bit faster...and our waitress took forever to bring our bread..water..and mixed drinks! But after she was quite attentive..food was delicious..I had the Farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic..it was amazing! Smoky..sharp..rich..mmm good! Oh! And don&#39;t order drinks! 12bucks for a margarita! Ridiculous..they have lost their damn minds lol..other than that id go back lol
Super disappointed. Service was crappy and so was my $23 plate of chicken alfredo. Was probably be most bland pasta I have ever had. Wont be back.

Slow, terrible service. Good food but pricey.  We took my mother here for her birthday for a late lunch. We arrived at the restaurant around 2 pm-not busy, many empty tables.  Our waitress was slow to take orders &amp; we didn&#39;t receive our meals until 3 pm! A 45 min wait after ordering!  Our waitress was less than interested in actually waiting on us-so it was ironic there was a suggested tip amount printed on each of our bills.  No-&#34; thank you for coming...hope you enjoyed your meal.&#34; I don&#39;t think she even told us her name-she certainly wasn&#39;t wearing a name tag.  The overall experience was less than inviting.  It will be a long time before we will consider returning.

Cleanliness 5<br>Service 5<br>Food 4<br>Overall 3<br><br>So your first might wonder why my overall grading is a 3 when the rest were 4/5. The thing that brought down the overall grade was the price. The food is great, service is great, but I felt I could have gotten something just as good somewhere else for considerable cheaper. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to go for special occasions, but I feel it is just simply expensive for what you get. They have a huge menu and lots of options! They have amazing service and really take care of their guests. But I guess you pay for it all in the end with the bill. <br><br>For the price that i received one slice of cheesecake I could have made one myself with just a few more dollars and received at least 8 times more. $7-$8 for one slice is alot IMO. Don&#39;t get me wrong, the cheesecake is amazing and tastes great.

I came here for my birthday. I was blown away with how busy and packed they were for 1 o&#39;clock. I was expecting quiet and not many people. They seated us quickly. I liked how the pager fit in my pocket. The restroom was cute but too small to accommodate that large of a volume of people. I was frustrated and disappointed that they seated people on either side of us, so we had no where to put our coats because we had booth seating on my side of the table and my other friends had the chairs. And being so scrunched together, I felt like my butt was on their table. Luckily the people on either side of us were friendly because privacy was definitely invaded. The food was the bomb. They forgot my friend&#39;s salad dressing and it took a while to flag down the waiter. Oh, my! My s&#39;mores cheesecake was delicious (and beautiful)! Our waiter gave us the wrong checks. He didn&#39;t seem very organized but then again, none of the staff seemed too enthused to be there. It was nice to visit with my friends but I felt claustrophobic. If it wasn&#39;t a special occasion, I wouldn&#39;t spend $8 for a slice of cheesecake.

The service here is always friendly and helpful. Cheesecake is always always busy and you can&#39;t make a reservation after five but the wait is reasonable. Unless you go in on a holiday or weekend that&#39;s expected to be busy, the wait is worth it. I always get a pasta or rice dish every time that I&#39;ve been. The staff is always helpful with choosing what is good and giving excellent recommendations. The drinks are awesome too.

I have been to a few locations in various states and had great service and delicious meals. The Westroads location is probably the worst one I have been to. I ordered the shrimp scampi and received the smallest portion I have ever received in any restaurant, almost a kid&#39;s size meal. The shrimp were fried instead of sautéed and the pasta was not thoroughly cooked. The sauce was too tart. The meal had no flavor except it was spiked with too much lemon juice. It was $20 for 1/2 a plate of nothingness. The description on the menu was not even close to what I received. I had 2 bites and was done. They didn&#39;t even charge me for this horrible meal, I guess as a courtesy. And the service was extremely slow. Never again.

$11.95 for a chocolate martini that was not good at all...no thank you! Last time for me. I&#39;ll stick to ordering their Chipotle chicken pasta on the curve and skip the drinks. It&#39;s the only dish I enjoy from there anyway.

Super disappointed as I&#39;ve enjoyed eating in here. Tonight decided that we wanted to try the take out. Called for curbside pick up. After 25 minutes called again to see what was taking so long and they couldn&#39;t find my order. Girl comes out with &#34;our order&#34; which was the wrong order. So we waited 25 more minutes for them to bring out the right order. Offered no discounts or even an apology for that matter. Get home and the food was cold so turns out it was probably ready the whole time and they just forgot about it. It will take a lot to get me to come back and eat here. Customer service was just awful.
Good food! But it takes 15 min to get a slice of cheesecake to go with no line at 8:30 on a Sunday night

Let me paint y&#39;all a picture. It&#39;s my 23rd birthday. I&#39;m in Omaha and my friends came all the way out from Wisconsin to see and be with me. I decide we should go to Cheesecake Factory for a nice dinner . Now let me tell you about my visit to this establishment. The Manhattan we ordered was watered down and the Arnold Palmer was purely just sweet tea and no lemonade. I ordered shrimp scampi and steak. The steak was covered in a mesquite barbecue sauce that should have been advertised because if I had know I would not have ordered it. The shrimp scampi came out cold and was the size was below average for what it cost. The shrimp scampi also had no noodles and a terrible flavor! I told the server that I did not like it and she said &#34;okay, love&#34; and walked away. I thought she was going to get a manager, but no manager ever came. The rest of our meal she did not make eye contact with me nor did she talk to me. We were charged full price for our terrible service and food. It made for a horrific birthday dinner experience.

As a party of four before peak dinner hours, we showed up expecting a limited wait time for seating. Instead, we waited over 10 minutes for a table seated uncomfortably close to another party, despite numerous other, more comfortable options. Upon viewing the menu, we were graced with too many choices, so this is not the place for the indecisive. I ordered the turkey burger with sweet potato fries in search of a lighter option. It did not meet my expectations for a $13 burger. One other member of my party got a pasta dish that she was unable to eat due to excess garlic. Throughout our entire experience, we had moody and inconsistent waitresses that did not treat us like seriously paying customers. Overall, The Cheesecake Factory is overpriced, underwhelming, and over-hyped. Will not be returning.

This place is horrible. Everything we ordered was not all that great. Only the cheesecake was good. I ordered the guacamole and it was tasteless. I told the waitress we were done eating it because it was very bland and not very good. She responded with oh ok and took the plate. Didn&#39;t ask to have something different or even a refund. And the salmon kale salad was a waste of money also. I think this places problem is the menu. Had way too many options to choose from. The smaller the menu the better quality food. I&#39;ll give it one star because the cheesecake is bomb.

Good place to eat!<br>We had spicy cashew chicken (good), nachos( good), mac &amp; cheese (good), the omelet(ok), kale salad( very good), tomato basil flat bread(ok) &amp; of course the desert.<br>Mango key lime ( excellent)  &amp; peppermint bark ( good). Overall the food &amp; service were good! We will come back again!

Stopped in today for lunch with my daughter. It was busy, no big deal, we weren&#39;t in a hurry, put our name in &amp; received the pager. There were 20+ people waiting in entry. Waited, waited &amp; waited some more- 25 minutes worth of waiting. Then there were two other parties of 2 (both of whom walked in AFTER us) &amp; my daughter and I. The other two parties who walked in AFTER us were seated. Then a name was called that sounded similar to mine. I stepped up to inquire about the name called. The girl rudely restated the name called and said&#34; it&#39;s not you!&#34;. Set the pager down &amp; walked out. Absolutely inexcusable to treat customers that way!

Had a gift certificate to cheese cake factory so stopped for lunch. Hubby had cheeseburger -- not much flavor,  saved most for our dog.  I had the French onion soup -- took one bite and stopped eating it.  It tasted like the greasy broth on the bottom of the pan a roast cooked in, and had some shredded cheese on top...horrible! Had the Chinese chicken salad. Half of the bagged lettuce was slimy and black.  Did find 6 thin pieces of chicken.  Probably the worst lunch I&#39;ve had! Will not be going back there again!

Feeling very disappointed! Our family of 10 started early thinking we could avoid the crowd. We got there at 4:55 and were told we would have a table ready in 15 minutes. 45 minutes later we were seated. It was very crowded and very noisy! Waitress tried her best but service was slow and some food was cold. The sautéed onions were not done and inedible. I ordered a French salad which was supposed to have asparagus spears and nuts. I found maybe two Asparugus ends rarely a nut. It had mounds of lettuce on top with no dressing. Very very dissaponted...........and we will not return.

I don&#39;t understand why this place is so popular.<br>What it is - is overpriced, that&#39;s for sure, even for lunch!<br>I&#39;ve ordered vegetarian pizza, which was hard and plain.<br>I&#39;ve also had salmon stake, it was better, but you could certainly cook such a stake yourself and save a lot of money.<br>I&#39;ve had 3 sorts of cheesecakes, wasn&#39;t overly impressed but quite like the one with mango.

Wow, is this place overpriced. I had a bowl of the white chicken chili and it barely covered the bottom of the bowl. It also came with a tiny scoop of white rice. I took one look at it and called the manager over...for 14 bucks the amount was ridiculous. He took a small amount off our bill and explained to me that the portions are weighed and consistent with all locations. Well, that maybe true but then corporate should really then look at what is being served because this is a total ripoff. I literally had the entree done with about six bites. The taste was good but not worth the price. The prices of other items way overpriced as well. I will not be eating here again. And, for crying out loud, get the entrance way fixed. Chunks of loose concrete by the front door does not make for a good first impression.<br>Darn shame because this was a decent place to eat at one time....

Ok, when this place first opened, I was excited because this was our go to place in Dallas. My initial visit was disappointing because they had discontinued what was arguably the absolute best salad anywhere...The Thai Steak Salad. After that, I would go if my wife begged me to go. They had other things I liked. So last night, after not going for a while, we went. What happened? The place was pretty empty, the poor desk hostess was working alone seating people best she could.<br><br>We ordered Fried zucchini, Factory Nachos, Factory Meatloaf and tea. The zucchini has gone from being cut into quarters to being this tiny stack of steak fry size pieces. The Factory Nachos looked like they must have been shipped on the plate, covered with this cheese sauce, that I couldn&#39;t eat. The pico on top was still in the shape of the container it came in and the guacamole had no taste at all. The Factory Meatloaf, which my wife and I both used to like, was terrible. <br><br>You guys do know that &#34;Factory&#34; is just a metaphor...don&#39;t you? Factories have line workers, restaurants have chefs. I ate some of the nacho chips...they were all toasted to the point of being burned. My wife moved the meatloaf around on the plate. I tasted it...it was awful. Nothing like it used to be. There is an expectation of restaurants...it comes from their legacy. She ordered the meatloaf because it was a safe bet. The whole experience felt like, some corporate guy decided that &#34;taste&#34; was an unwarranted expense and cut it out of the budget. <br><br>It&#39;s a shame really. The Cheesecake Factory used to be a decent place to eat.  <br><br>I suggested that next time we should order a sandwich....my wife said...there will be no next time.

We visit here frequently because its usual a decent chain in Omaha however today are visit was horrible! Service was horrible!!! No bread was served, menus left on the table, drinks left untitled and quite frankly she forgot about us !  We waited a hour to finally get our food (keep in mind place was empty) when we finally got our food they had forgotten things, food was cold and not good!! So we waited a hour for this! Brought it to the mangers attention and it seemed he could care less! Not a good way to run a business! We will not be back better service at chick fil a !!

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory. I came here yesterday for my sisters birthday. My favorite dish is the Factory Burrito, but yesterday I had the four cheese pasta with chicken and got a slice of pumpkin cheese cake to go. The food, service, cleanliness and decor has always been great. This is definitely a place I&#39;ll keep returning to.
If you like hair in your food, then this is definitely the place to go. Happened to us 6 times in the last 2 years.
Great food , extensive menu , serves the absolute best cheesecake with courteous service and an atmosphere that&#39;s hard to beat within budget ...
I saw a fried bug on my food. This is very disappointing. This is unsanitary!! I almost threw up!!! And felt very disgusted! Cheese Cake Factory you have failed.

Service: okay at best <br>Food: the fried mac and cheese is to DIE FOR to be honest haven&#39;t had much else there so sorry<br>Cheesecake: delightful the only bad part is I always have to take it home cause I&#39;m so full... Maybe I&#39;ll start with the cheesecake best time lol<br><br>Not bad not bad

First off, I like the cheesecake factory. They have good food, and they have options for every possible picky eater. I mean picky eater to the max! Their menu is a small book, and that isn&#39;t an exaggeration. The down fall is it can take a while to decide if you aren&#39;t sure what you are in the mood for. You get warm bread while you are waiting, which is nice. You really don&#39;t need a whole appetizer its so much food. They have a good sized drink menu, but a bit pricey. Last time I was there my glass of wine was $9. A bit much for half a glass. Their portions are ridiculous. Everything I have ever ordered there comes with enough food to feed at least two people if not three. All servings are doubled if not tripled. I go home with a few meals from the left overs, which I can&#39;t complain about to much. The food is good, but honestly, its nothing special. It&#39;s average food. The cheesecake is on a whole new level, that&#39;s why I gave it 4 stars. I have never had bad cheese cake there. It is so good and there are so many choices! I usually get it to go because I&#39;m so full from the other food! It is quite pricey for a meal, but with the serving sizes so big you do get what you pay for. The cheesecake slices aren&#39;t cheap, but oh so worth it! This isn&#39;t a place I go often at all, but when I do I splurge on the cheesecake. If you are looking for a place with a menu of choices for everyone, this is the place to go. Just don&#39;t expect to walk out wowed by the food and expect your waist line to be pushing the seams a bit! and make sure to splurge on a piece of cheesecake :)

Two weeks in the USA and this place wins the award for worst service. An hour and 10 minute wait for a seat is acceptable even though a 45 minute estimate was given. However waiting over an hour for the food to arrive was unacceptable with no apology  for such an extended delay. The food was average at best.

Menu meant for all is the nickname that I like to give the Cheesecake Factory. I really enjoy the skinny menu and the gluten free menu. I had the skinny girl Mexican salad with a light dressing drizzle. The salad was an extremely large portion like normal salads at cheesecake but made for perfect leftovers for lunch the next day.

I have eaten @ this restaurant all over the country and I go because they have above average food and I know what I can order and it is the same everywhere. This time the service was ok. Speed was pretty slow and the food was below average. Disappointed by this location.

I would give it no stars if I could, we went there 1-31 for my daughters 16th birthday, per her request. Her pasta was lumpy, and apps were not very good flavor wise and my daughter really wanted to have the staff sing her happy Birthday just like she saw at all the other tables, our waitress put her price of cheese cake down stuck a candle unit and left. I can&#39;t say it ruined her birthday but I can say she was very disappointed

I will keep this short and sweet. Our food came out in 3 parts . 2 plates, 2 plates, then 1. It took 10 min for this, so by the time my food arrived everyone elses was cold. Burger was overcooked, when I asked for rare. The server barely waited on us. That&#39;s the short...cheesecake was good, there is your sweet.

I am celiac and I specifically explained this to the waitress when ordering my food, but according to my stomach, my meal was clearly full of gluten. I am so disappointed especially since their gf menu is very basic and marked gf. This should not have been an issue.
Amazing food, decent prices and great service. I love the menu size and the portions were great! Having so many options were fantastic but it was hard to choose. I loved it!
Food is always good &amp; service is always good. Definitely my boyfriend and I&#39;s go to restaurant! Although, as a hostess myself, I have noticed the hostesses lack friendliness.

I have only ever gotten cheesecake here, so I can&#39;t speak to their dine in menu. However, if you&#39;re ever in the mood for a giant, most of your calories for the day, slice of cheesecake, this is the place. They have a ton of different flavors and all are just as naughty. The staff vary in politeness though and sometimes they try to get skimpy on the whipped topping. I need my whipped topping dang you!

I honestly have no idea why I come back every so often..went there yesterday for National Cheesecake day, it was busy but no busier than another time we&#39;ve been there.  <br>It was about a 15 minute wait to be seated, once seated it took about 5 minutes to get any water and a total of 10 minutes to get our drinks.  Server immediately asked if we were getting cheesecake (we were planning on getting food too), we hesitated for a moment and said yes.  Ordered our cheese cakes, they literally took 20-30 minutes to receive; only after them giving it to the table next to us, so they noticed the mistake and took it from the other table and then gave it to me..but had my guests order wrong..there wee tables around us who ordered after us and got their order before us.  The service was hands down the worst ever.<br>Thank goodness the cheesecakes were half off but they sure bent us over on our drinks at $11 each, will never be getting anything but water in the future if there is one.

I have been here a couple times the service  is always good my daughter who is 11 got her food and like any other time started to eat half way through it she bit into something hard she pulled out a piece of plastic I told the waitress and she new exactly what it was it was some sort of cap from the kitchen she got the manager involved he came by and asked if everything was alright I said no he apologized and said my daughter&#39;s meal will be free and a piece of cheese cake but when the bill came only the meal was subtracted not the cheese cake we ordered we are not there to get a free meal but if you as a manager say something to a customer keep your word will think about going back

I&#39;m waffling between giving two or three stars.  Typically I don&#39;t like to review chain restaurants at all because they&#39;re all pretty consistent and you know what you&#39;re getting (or at least you should) when you go there.  But last night at the cheesecake factory I remembered a couple of reasons why I don&#39;t typically eat there.<br><br>The cheesecake is obviously 3 or 4 stars in quality, but it costs $9.  I&#39;m pretty sure I could buy the ingredients to make a whole cheesecake at home for that price.  <br><br>The dirty martini I ordered (which our server said the bartender described as &#39;extra dirty) was also $9.  The blue cheese stuffed olives that are listed as part of the drink on the menu... I had to ask for after it showed up without them.  Plus, &#39;extra dirty&#39;?  Really?  The irony here is that it may sound cute, but the &#39;dirty&#39; is the olive juice... so you put extra olive juice in my martini?  Thanks, but no thanks.  You can just make it extra-ginny instead.<br><br>The food is always good, nothing to write home about.  And the portions lend themselves to excessive eating.  I&#39;ve never been absolutely disappointed with a meal here, until I get the check.<br><br>I probably would have gone with the three stars if I didn&#39;t feel like they were holding me by my ankles to shake out all the loose change in my pockets.  All told, one martini, one dinner and one piece of cheesecake to go set me back $37.  I can think of far more fabulous places to spend that money in town.

I took my sons.  We had a good time.  The place was packed but it was Sunday evening. We all had plenty to eat.  The menu has a lot to choose from. We had to take desert home with us because we were so full.  The portions are pretty sizable.  The service was pretty good considering it was packed.

My mother and I have came from Sioux City and when I heard that Omaha had a Cheesecake Factory near by, I was excited. The food was delicious, don&#39;t get me wrong. The filet mignon was just right. However, I was bothered by the customer service. We were seated down before the table besides us and they have gotten served first and the waitress didn&#39;t seem to care much about serving our table. We didn&#39;t even get our bread, I didn&#39;t even know about the bread until we looked around and every table had a loaf besides ours. Then when I paid, I went to get a slice of Tiramisu cheesecake and here is a group of employees who were too busy talking to one another, I kept calling out, &#34; Excuse me? Excuse me...&#34; and they were still ignoring me until I was about to turn and leave and that&#39;s when one of the girl took her time to approach me and had the sloppiest attitude. Smh.

We have eaten at Cheesesteak Factory several times and everything is usually good. <br>Tonight, five people went for my daughter&#39;s birthday.  4 of the 5 entrees arrived after a lengthy period, but a burger came at least another 10 minutes after the four other entrees. The burger that was ordered well done came rare.  I had to go seek out the waitress but never found her, so told the hostess.  She said the manager would come over.  Another five minutes passed and still no manager...went back to the hostess to say &#34;we just want the burger cooked longer, can someone just come pick up the burger ?&#34;.  More time went by before someone came to get the burger. The manager apologized and basically said she would comp the burger.  I told her this really wrecked my daugher&#39;s birthday dinner.  She offered free cheesecake.  Ok, we&#39;ll take it. <br> I am not kidding that another 15-20 minutes went by before the burger finally came.  The free cheesecake had to be requested two times before it came.  <br>I don&#39;t know what happened tonight, but it was very awfully frustrating.
I have been to Cheesecake Factories all over the country and this was by far the worst service. Seating experience wasn&#39;t good and it took over an hour to get our food after we ordered.

Me and a buddy went to The cheesecake factory. Well, we have been here multiple times before but never left reviews. <br><br>We got there and it was somewhat busy, but that is to be expected. I got the menu and it was like getting a miniature phone book. Way too many items on the list...but even though the menu was large...the food was decent. <br><br>I ordered the Avocado egg rolls for an appetizer and the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp. Both were really good...just a little pricey.
Ate at the bar.  Drinks were good but the food is mediocre at best.  Whoever cooked the Steak Diane needs to be retrained.

Words can&#39;t even begin to describe the awesomeness that was this meal...Never having been to a CF yet hearing good things I was still pretty stunned with the quality...Our server Sarah was great and friendly and a real credit to the CF...Snow and I started off with Chicken fried sliders, and chicken pot-stickers in this indescribably tasty sauce...the sliders were perfect, not too hard/crunchy and just really tasty...the pot-stickers themselves were pretty damn good, but the sauce was next level awesomeness...and it made for an excellent dipping sauce for the bread...Snow ordered a ginormous salad, which she ended up taking home to make room for cheesecake...Sound decision...I ordered the chicken and biscuits with mashed taters and veggies...now, I&#39;m not normally a big vegetable person...to be honest, I hate the damn things...but CF actually made them tasty and delicious...the chicken was perfectly cooked, the biscuits were also as good as they could possibly get, and even the mashed taters I loved...even with the peelings inside, which normally drives me insane, but CF even made that taste good lol...I couldn&#39;t even eat it all since naturally I had to leave room for cheesecake...Snow ordered the lemon meringue cheesecake and I ordered the Reese&#39;s peanut butter cheesecake...Now is where words may fail me because upon taking that first bite I blacked out from sheer orgasmic joy at the tastiness that I had just put into my mouth...Never have I had something so yummy and out of this world excellent...I will be using this memory as my permanent happy place when I&#39;m down, that&#39;s how good it was...Snow&#39;s choice was also just as awesome...I honestly have no complaints which is why CF gets an immediate 5 stars even after only one visit...yes they&#39;re expensive, but this isn&#39;t Denny&#39;s or the Village Inn...do yourself a favor and come here as soon as possible because it&#39;s just that damn good...

Terrible birthday for me.  This was the worst dining experience I have had in over a decade.  The food was awful, had a Steak Dianne- it was cold and greasy.  I&#39;m now sick to my stomach (yes I vommitted)<br><br>The service was even worse, she was rude and didn&#39;t care.  The manager in the purple shirt wouldn&#39;t talk to me or the other table that also wanted to complain.<br><br>Unfortunately the place was packed so they don&#39;t care that they are terrible.

We used the gift card that we got for Christmas. The interior was very high class very comfortable. The food was pretty good but I had a hard baguette for my sandwich so my meal was not very good. Naturally this place does great cheesecake as the sign says however not really sure I would go back unless I had a good reason to go. The other people seem to like it and they thought the food was very good. The service was exceptional and overall I thought it was a good experience.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorite places to dine however last night the wait 45 minutes just to be seated, we waited an hour for our food, and when we asked our waitress, Della did they offer a military discount, well, unfortunately they didn&#39;t offer that as well. Very disappointed!!

Came here for dinner with 3 other people  on a Saturday night at 6:30 pm with no reservations - 1 hour wait.  Line was out the door.  Against my better judgement, we decided to stay.  Finally seated.  Server was very good, but he was slammed!  He asked us to be patient - kitchen and bakery were backed up.  2 of us had Spicy Cashew Chicken, another had garlic noodles w/chicken and one had avocado/zucchini fries and another appetizer.  Food quality was fine; it was hot.  Service was good.  Dessert service was VERY slow, as the server told us it would be.  (We all ordered cheesecake, of course.)  I was not terribly impressed by the cheesecake.  I&#39;ve had much better.  It was just OK.    For the prices, the food should be much better than it is.  It seems exactly like a factory, where they just shove people in, and shove people out.  Really hard to enjoy a meal there.  So noisy!  Holds 365 people, and I think they had that many there!! Just not my cup of tea for a Saturday night dinner, but it wasn&#39;t my choice that night.  I won&#39;t go back.

Started with 2 cokes, got the fish tacos which I received 4, I did 2 fried and 2 grilled fish. They were good but need extra tortilla on each soaked right through and made mess. Gf had the chicken Alfredo tasted really good, recommend small portion. Got cheese cake white chocolate raspberry truffle not as good as dutch apple last time. she got cookies and cream not as good as peanut butter cup. water was OK, didn&#39;t check back many times. bill was $58 plus tip. food from $9.99-$25.99 cheesecake $7.50 a slice. many things $9.99-$14.99.
Nice night.  Food was good.  Service was prompt and friendly.   Cheesecake was very good.  Went on a Wednesday night before rush hour.  We&#39;ll be back in the future.

I&#39;ve always been a fan of the cheesecake factory.  You know going in that you are gonna get a huge meal that is totally unhealthy, but delicious.  Some of my personal favorites are the barbeque ranch chicken salad, any of the burgers and the cuban sandwich.  The salad is actually big enough to share and loaded with enough toppings to the last bite, but they could go a little easier on the dressing amount.  Probably my new favorite is the cuban, just fantastic and perfectly prepared with great taste, tender meat and just the right amount of sauce.<br><br>Everything on the menu tends to be worth the money, but then again you are paying a little more for the portion sizes and experience.  The wait staff was friendly, but a little slow.  They never offered extra bread and actually could have come by more often, especially at the end of the meal.

Why I like it:  HUGE menu, lots of variety on cheesecakes, and good drinks.  That&#39;s it in a nutshell.  Let me expand a bit.  Cheesecake Factory is a chain, so they automatically loose a star for that, but they are a upscale chain restaurant with very nice décor and better then average food.  Not everything at the cheesecake factory is good, I have eaten at a number of them and can tell you first hand things like shepherds pie and some of the salads are fairly blah.  However that said, they do have a few dishes I like.  <br><br>1st, for appetizer I enjoy the firecracker salmon.  It is salmon wrapped in wontons wrappers and deep fried, served on a huge pile of red cabbage and drizzled with a nice teriyaki sauce.  Very tasty but not enough food for more then 2 people.  Heck, I have eaten it by myself as an app myself. Vietnamese Shrimp Summer Rolls are also excellent as an App.<br><br>2nd.  They used to have an excellent Thai Chicken Pasta that I enjoyed but for some reason they got rid of it.  They still have some nice pasta options like spicy chipotle chicken and the pasta carbonara.  Other things I really enjoy include Herb Crusted Filet of Salmon, Fish Tacos, and the chicken and biscuits are excellent. It reminds me of a deconstructed chicken pot pie with peppery white gravy.<br><br>And now for the cheesecakes.  Yes I have tried nearly every flavor at one point or another over the last 20+ years visiting a cheesecake factory someplace in the country.  In fact I visited my first one in Newport Beach, CA back in 1990.  I&#39;m not even sure if its still there!  But, over the years I have developed a taste for a few of them, and can rank them in what I believe is their worst, to their best. <br><br>Here we go:<br><br>32. Low Carb Cheesecake with Strawberries<br> - Yuck<br>31. White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Nut<br> - Not a fan of white chocolate with caramel.<br>30. Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake<br> Coffee in dessert is not my thing<br>29. Tiramisu<br> I&#39;ll stick with the original, and I don&#39;t really like coffee in my desserts.<br>28. Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake<br> Not very good<br>27. The Original<br> Boring<br>26. Chocolate Mousse<br> Not a fan of mousse. I want a better chocolate.<br>25. White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle<br> This one is ok, but again, not a fan of white chocolate<br>24. Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple<br> Not bad, but they have better<br>23. The Original with Cherry Preserves<br> The original is good, and cherry makes it a little better<br>22. Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cake Cheesecake<br> I like carrot cake, but this one is a miss<br>21. Key Lime<br> I like it, but it&#39;s a weee bit tart<br>20. Ultimate Red Velvet Cake<br> Getting better on the chocolate front but they have better<br>19. Mango Key Lime<br> This is a good option for tart and sweet.<br>18. Dulce de Leche Caramel Cheesecake<br> This is a good one, worth trying.<br>17. Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake<br> Reminds me of banana cream pie, but better<br>16. Pina Colada Cake<br> Different take. I feel like I&#39;m in the islands<br>15. Caramel Pecan Turtle Cheesecake<br> Love me a turtle in any way. This is a good option<br>14. Vanilla Bean Cheesecake<br> For something so simple, it works.  Tastes like rich vanilla ice cream.<br>13. Dutch Apple Caramel Streusel<br> Apple Pie Cheesecake.  It is good<br>12. Wild Blueberry White Chocolate Cheesecake<br> This is the only white chocolate cheesecake I actually like<br>11. Chocolate Tuxedo Cream<br> Vanilla and Chocolate twist.  Very good<br>10. Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;mores Galore<br> This is one of my favorites.  Worth getting for sure.<br>9. Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake<br> If you want chocolate, this one is great, but almost TOO much chocolate. it&#39;s fairly dark chocolate.<br>8. The Original with Fresh Strawberries<br> A classic, and very very good.<br>7. Reese&#39;s Peanut Butter Chocolate Cake.<br> The best peanut butter cake I have had in some time.  Great if you don&#39;t want a cheesecake<br>6. 30th Anniversary Chocolate Cake<br> Probably the best chocolate item they have.  perfect flavors<br>5. Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough<br> I am so partial to chocolate chip cookie dough anything, and this cheesecake is excellent.<br>4. OREO Dream Extreme<br> If you like Oreo&#39;s, you will love this cheesecake.  I do.<br>3. Lemon Raspberry Cream<br> When you are sick of chocolate, this sweet and tart cheesecake is perfect.  My favorite fruit cheesecake they have. <br>2. Hershey&#39;s Chocolate Bar Cheesecake<br> This is also probably the best chocolate item they have. Honestly, this and the 30th aniv chocolate cake are both fantastic, but this one is readily available everywhere.<br>1. Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake<br> This is the best of the best.  German Chocolate, coconut, pecan frosting, omg, this thing is the bomb.

This place has some serious service issues. I met my friend here at 1 pm on a Wednesday, and the restaurant was packed. (Great for them!)  My friend&#39;s in-laws were in the bar area at a table so we decided to take their table as they were just leaving. Once the table had been bused, the server brought us water and bread and butter. I asked her for silverware, assuming this would prompt her to bring us the normal table place setting (napkin, silverware, plates, salt &amp; pepper) but she only brought silverware. We asked for napkins and plates, she only brought napkins, so she had to go back a third time for plates. My friend ordered coffee and I ordered a beer. She brought the coffee, then brought us both beer. We told her we wanted to order soup and share a couple of appetizers. She said something like &#34;since you are sharing soup, would you like the bowl versus the cup since it&#39;s larger?&#34; I had to actually explain to her that we would like our own cup of soup and we&#39;d share the appetizers.  After a long wait, the soup came out and it was cold. It took us more than 5 minutes to flag someone down to send it back. 10 minutes later they re-served the soup which was only slightly warmer than previously. A full hour and 10 minutes after we placed our order we had still not received the two appetizers. No one had checked on us since re-serving the soup. Once again we flagged down our server and told her to cancel the order and bring us the check. She asked us to wait while she spoke to her manager. She came back with one of the two appetizers and said that her manager will waive the charge for them if we&#39;d still like them, or they could box them up. Neither one of us planned to have an all afternoon lunch, but we decided just to stay and have some. She brought the 2nd appetizer, but no plates, we just used our tiny bread plates. It was a small table and they hadn&#39;t cleared away any of our dirty plates, glasses or the soup bowls, so I tried to stack them and get them out of our way. Eventually our server walked by and stopped, grabbed some of our dirty dishes and put them on the same tray with food she was taking to another table. I almost stopped her, but I was too shocked by what I was seeing happen! Oh, and the food? We had the eggroll sampler and the Thai chicken lettuce wraps. They were just okay. I finally got out of there at 3:25. Ridiculous!

Tried to go there on a Saturday night after 9. We had a large party and were told that it would be a 45 minute wait unless we wanted to split up our group. Hostess was not pleasant. Can&#39;t speak to the food but based on that experience there&#39;s not much reason to go back.

Omaha&#39;s Cheese Cake Factory is awful. There three days ago place was empty. Food was cold and the service was awful!  Our waitress couldn&#39;t get  salad dressing any sooner than 10 min. Lots of other places to eat in Omaha. Take this one off you list.

1 star due to being food poisoned. I went with my fiance, sister, and brother in law. I got the mushroom burger. The next day I was nauseous,but that night was the worst night of my life. I thought maybe I was getting that nasty bug that&#39;s going around. Oh no...my fiance ate my other half of my burger leftovers the next night and is now sick just like I was. Lasted about 8 hours of pure DEATH! It was everyone&#39;s first time except for me...thought it would be a nice night out to celebrate the holidays...
It&#39;s Cheesecake Factory you should know what you&#39;re getting, over priced mediocre food.

So I got a message from the Cheese Cake Factory&#39;s manager saying I should have brought it up to them about my food being cold. Well I did to your server and all she said was, &#34;Oh, I&#39;m sorry&#34;. Your place was packed when we left. Maybe the manager should go around and ask their guest how every thing is going. Trust and believe I will Never eat at your place again. I only went since my daughter came out of town to visit me. She wanted to eat there. I don&#39;t like eating in Omaha. Only in Sarpy CO, or CB.

My Friends and I went there, as a diebetic I will admit it was a bad place for me to go... could have easily killed myself there ;0)<br><br>Ordered a nice pasta dish that came out in a huge plate admittedly it was like $17, but we all ordered something we wanted and then we got several plates and shared the portions were large enough to make that a great way to try lots of stuff. The food all of it was good I&#39;ll admit to having better else where, but it was still good.<br><br>Then came the deserts!<br><br>Again we all order what we wanted and they were large enough to share with 4 people.... white chocolate musse cheesecake.... chocolate mint cheesecake.... white chocolate macodamia nut cookie cheesecake?..... and the BOMB Red Velvet Cack Cheesecake!!!!!!  <br><br>If for no other reason go there for the desert!!!!!!! I could have put myself in a coma and been happy to be there!
The host should not have that work position as a employee.  She was there like a mute not even smile.  I know that&#39;s rude for any client and bad for the company because I have a business too

I&#39;ve never been here before but my bf said it was a good place and he wasn&#39;t joking! They have everything!! I have never seen a place with so many diverse food choices. The only thing is that it is a little pricey for my liking. The food was, however amazing. I had the little crab cake bites and a house salad and I tried my bf&#39;s pretzel chicken and it was great. (Wish I had ordered that instead of my salad though lol) The dipping sauces where also very good and the service was great! Even with them being super busy we got our food and drinks in a timely manner. The waiter was also very pleasant and helpful.   I will definitely go back.

We were there around 3 mos. ago and the service took foreverrr. It looked like our server had 2 entire sections to contend with. All told, I think we were there for a late lunch for about 2 hrs. Totally ridiculous. I&#39;m sure some of it was due to a delay in the kitchen.   The club sandwich is good, but huge, so if you are not going home right away, then what do you do with all the leftovers? You can&#39;t leave turkey sit in a warm car while you go out and about.<br><br>Tried again today, having the Fish &amp; Chips. The breading was barely crisp on the outside, all soggy in the middle and seriously, there was barely any fish inside the 4 pieces for lunch sized portion. Fries were average, coleslaw a little waxy tasting. Ordered a bowl of clam chowder soup, an extra $4.98. For the quality of my meal, I could have gone to Arthur Treachers or Village Inn for much less money. Strike that, just pick up some frozen fish sticks from Walmart and you&#39;d have the same quality.<br><br>Server seemed more preoccupied with chatting with staff elsewhere at the front counters. I wish I could have whistled loud enough to get his attention to call him over. Took forever to get the soup to the table (brought by a different employee finally), and then our server brought my meal out a minute later. He only had two tables to attend to, so not sure why he couldn&#39;t have checked back at the proper times. He also seemed to really not care about if my meal was okay or not, he seemed to rush past (to do what, I have no clue). His tip reflected his attitude.<br><br>I think Cheesecake Factory needs to do better to get my business. We are not going to go out of our way to eat here and spend $50 on lunch again.<br><br>Red Velvet Cheesecake is quite good, but was a bit on the dry side, so wonder if it was fresh or what.<br><br>Avoid the fish &amp; chips and as far as service, just hope for the best.<br><br>Update: upon emailing corporate and giving feedback, they kindly passed my remarks along and I did receive a gift card in the mail. I&#39;m pleased that corporate does care about the feedback they are receiving in regard to the menu.
Poor service.  Waiting for an hour + with a family and children is unacceptable. We checked in and moved to bar area and was switched waiters twice.

Nothing to see here, folks. <br><br>I&#39;ve come here with friends and/or family three times, and on all three occasions I left disappointed. The corny yet elegant atmosphere, association with cheese-cake, and high prices lead you to believe that your meal here will be decadent and bursting with flavor. Unfortunately, everything I&#39;ve eaten here has been just the opposite. Bland, flavorless, forgettable... <br><br>The cheesecake is alright, but nothing extravagant, and definitely nothing to write home about. <br><br>If I was just rating on the basis of the quality of the meals I&#39;ve had, I&#39;d give this place one star. However, many of the meals come in massive portions, the design of the dining room is pretty neat (though childish), and most of my friends and family have been satisfied with their food, so they limp into a second star.<br><br>My suggestion to Cheesecake Factory would be to focus less on offering a hundred bad meals and more on offering a dozen or two good ones.

I just have to say the management and staff here were awesome!  I wanted to surprise my boyfriend for his birthday last night and they completely helped me do that.  Miguel, supervisor, had my table ready to go at 7 with a bottle of wine and the balloons I brought in and the service was fantastic!  The food was spot on and the night was amazing.  I couldn&#39;t have thanked them anymore for accommodating what I wanted.

I love the cheesecake factory... but this one sucks.  Poor service, and food seemed off!  How do you mess up SHRIMP?!  <br><br>It wasnt peak time - there was no wait to be seated... plenty of empty tables.  Yet it took me about 10 minutes to get a menu, another 15 to get water and bread.  WTF<br><br>Its a shame - because normally I love this place to eat; I guess not in Omaha is the lesson I learned.

A review from one of my eighth grade students...<br><br>Pros<br>Great food<br>Clean <br>Amazing desert<br>Reasonable hours<br><br>Cons<br>Service takes a while<br>Waiting for a table<br>Busy <br><br>        I have had many great experiences at The Cheesecake Factory. The Food is high quality and it has great prices. I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a place to grab lunch or dinner and  dessert. They are open at reasonable hours Monday through Thursday they are open at 11:00 am- 11:00 pm, Friday and Saturday they are open from 11:00 am- 12:00 am. On Sunday they are open from 10:00 am- 10:00 pm. The prices range from $11.00 to $30.00 for most of the food items on the menu. They take reservations and its family friendly. <br><br>        The longest I have ever waited for a table at the Cheesecake Factory is about fifteen to twenty minutes. The servers are nice and friendly but they can take a while to get to your table because it is always so busy. They allow reservation and they have carry out so it is great if you&#39;re lazy and you want to stop by after work and get something to eat. I would recommend the Chicken Picatta it is full of flavor and it&#39;s good if you like lemons.<br><br>        Overall my experiences have always been great here the food is delicious and the environment is clean. Although it is very busy I think the food is worth the wait. The restaurant is family friendly but it is not overwhelmingly loud. The Cheesecake factory has a vast menu so there will always be something new to try. This restaurant is a great choice for any occasion.<br><br>Another review from one of my 8th-grade students...<br><br>Pros,<br> the food was good,<br> the building&#39;s design was realty cool<br> the people who worked there were really nice.  <br><br>Cons, <br>there wasn&#39;t a lot of lighting,<br> confusion with the employees,  <br><br> The Cheesecake Factory at Westroads mall is known for their cheesecake, hence the name. Just because it is all about cheesecake it doesn&#39;t mean that is all they serve. They have a variety of lunch and dinner items. The building is a dimly lit place with cool artwork decorating the walls. I think the restaurant is Egyptian themed but I am not sure. <br><br> When I went to The Cheesecake Factory for the first time I didn&#39;t have the best experience. I got there on a Sunday at about 3:30. It was surprisingly busy at this time. I have not gone on a different day other than a Sunday so I don&#39;t know if it is that busy every day. The time I arrived was the period in which they were switching shifts. So our waiter got confused. Even Though they were having some problems finding who was supposed to serve us, the employees were very kind and tried their hardest to fix the mess.<br> unfortunately, it was just a lot of waiting. When I came I was just there for the cheesecake. Let&#39;s just say I was very impressed. My family and I all ordered cheesecake to share with each other. The only other thing I ordered was a smoothy. The cheesecake tasted really good. It was rich and was everything cheesecake should be. My favorite was the white chocolate raspberry. On the other hand, my smoothy was not that great. It lost its flavor and tasted like ice with some mango. Even Though I didn&#39;t have a fantastic time, I think it is still a good place to go for a treat. <br> <br>This is definitely not a restaurant for people on a diet. It is nearly impossible to resist such good looking food. Obviously, cheesecake isn&#39;t very healthy, but it can&#39;t hurt to have some every once and awhile. The only thing that really bothered me was that they didn&#39;t have much for lighting. It was hard to adjust after coming from a sunny day. I would not recommend you go there if you have trouble seeing in low light. Also, I recommend not going on the weekend.

Although I prefer to support locally owned restaurants, we were given a gift card for Christmas.  The service was excellent and our entrees were delicious.  Not a fan of the side salad I ordered and will forego it in the future.  My fiancé&#39;s Chicken Costoletta was delicious and enough for two meals.  I had the best Fish and Chips I have ever had in Nebraska...again enough for two meals!

Not really impressed overall.  Stopped in on a Sunday evening and the place was packed, so it is definitely popular with a lot of people.  I am always immediately skeptical when a restaurants menu is the size of a children&#39;s book.  Usually when you try to be everything to everyone, you end up being mediocre at best.  That pretty much sums up my experience.  As the place was packed, our server seemed a bit overwhelmed.  She was friendly, but it took quite a while to grab our drink orders and ask if we wanted to put in any appetizers.  Not a big deal, but to wait then a bit longer for our drinks, only she forgot mine.  After a second reminder, my single Moscow Mule showed up 25 minutes after I ordered it.  I ordered the Rib Eye, and it was fair at best.  It was prepared just fine, but was somewhat tough and lacked flavor.  Our server managed one water refill during dinner, and pretty much all 9 of our water glasses were empty for the last 25+ minutes we were there.  While overall this place doesn&#39;t merit a 2 star review, it barely makes 3 in my book.  There simply was nothing that was a stand out, and our server simply had way too many tables to contend with to provide decent service to any of them.

What can you say about Cheesecake Factory? If you&#39;ve been to one, you&#39;ve been to them all. There was no wait for a table and the food arrived quickly. This location was a lot less busy than the one on Michigan Ave. in Chicago. I ordered the Baja Tacos with the black beans and rice. The fish was a llittle bland, but the beans and rice were tasty. My grandmother ordered the fried shrimp and they were really good. The keylime cheesecake is yummy, even though I did not taste any cream cheese, it was more like keylime pudding. We had two different waitresses and they were both pleasant and friendly.

This review pertains to the To Go service.  I have now been waiting 45 minutes for ONE order.  The server just informed me that she has &#34;talked to the kitchen manager&#34; and they are &#34;working on it&#34;.  It is 7:30 on a Tuesday night.  The restaurant is not busy.  I called in a To Go order because I wanted To Go home with it.  They should probably rename this process To Wait.

The menu is huge.  Almost too many choices.  I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and it was delicious.  We ordered garlic cheese bread and it also was very good.  What I didn&#39;t like was the cheesecake.  It was mediocre and at $8 a slice I expected much more.  This is my first time eating here and because the food was so good I would eat there again but I would skip the cheesecake.

Okay, do not get me wrong...I am a BIG Cheesecake Factory fan!  I love the West Des Moines, Iowa location with all my heart.  I know what I like and I do not care what people who think they&#39;re &#34;foodies&#34; who rely on only local restaurants think.  If you&#39;re so cross that you think you too good to eat at huge, clean, beautiful Cheesecake Factory, and would rather eat at some rat trap local restaurant instead (not all local restaurants are like that, but I&#39;m just giving an example if you went there and it was run down and dirty), be my guest (actually, don&#39;t be).<br><br>THAT said, I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake Factory locations, and this one was clean and nice looking like the others, but for Omaha&#39;s size, it was WAY too small.  The waiting area and the bakery area were consolidated into one area, making it very difficult for employees to wafer through the crowds with cheesecake for the bakery.  The waiting area itself is extremely small, and not enough seating was available for our wait (it didn&#39;t matter to me, but to someone who is disabled or can&#39;t stand for long periods of time, it would be).  <br><br>Just on a side note: This was the first Cheesecake Factory that I&#39;ve been to that is freestanding, and not connected to a plaza or major super regional mall.<br><br>Once we were seated (we were quoted 15, and it ended up being 45...minus one star), the waiter promptly brung us bread (wheat is the best!) and took our order.  Me and the boyfriend&#39;s meals were perfect!  Had my usual Pasta Da Vinci with extra extra shrimp (overpriced, but awesome) and extra mushrooms, and had key lime cheesecake for dessert.  <br><br>Customer service great...one star.  Decor...very nice...one star.  Food...awesome as always...one star.  No fourth or fifth star because of the small waiting area and the extensive waiting time to be seated.<br><br>We arrived at 5PM on a Saturday evening, and boy was it busy!  Please plan ahead when deciding to come here during peak times.  <br><br>Personally, I think The Cheesecake Factory would have been more appropriate to be built out by Village Pointe (or Regency Court), where upscale shopping is key.  Westroads Mall is the largest mall in Omaha (and all of Nebraska, for that matter), but not the nicest.  But I can&#39;t help that...thank you!

Pros: Dessert is good<br><br>Cons: Everything else<br><br>I remember my parents calling me all excited when they found out Cheesecake Factory was finally opening a location in Omaha. &#34;We&#39;re finally on the map!&#34; Okay, maybe it isn&#39;t THAT spectacular, but people in my hometown took the news as if the second coming of Christ arrived. I&#39;ve eaten at Cheesecake Factories everywhere, and have always had one question: Why do so many people love this place?<br><br>I can&#39;t stand it. Every location is way too busy (even in cities with strong restaurant scenes like Seattle, Dallas and Chicago), it&#39;s too loud, there&#39;s nowhere to sit, you feel rushed, it&#39;s overpriced, the menu is expansive, which is always a warning flag for me as they make many things but specialize in none, they give you way too much to eat and it had a bland, boring atmosphere to it.<br><br>The Omaha location isn&#39;t any different.<br><br>Omahans LOVE chains, which disturbs me as more chains are taking over from the charming local restaurants that I used to love in my hometown. Do yourself a favor: skip this place and give your money to one of the local restaurants out there.

My first experience with Cheesecake Factory was back in Seattle, and I could never understand how in a city with such fantastic restaurant options, people would wait more than an hour for marginal food.  The popularity in Omaha is completely out of whack with the food and experience, and I wish I had an explanation as to why people flock here in droves.  I have the following theories:<br><br>1) Good Housekeeping had an article that eating at this place cures female fertility problems.<br>2) They have a secret menu for Republicans that&#39;s a massive improvement over their menu for everyone else.<br>3) People with children eat for free.<br><br>Otherwise, I can&#39;t explain why this place is so popular and also so mediocre and overpriced.

Food is average at best. Dessert was good, but as usual, expensive. <br><br>Our waitress was Angela. She had to be hyped up on 3-4 cups of coffee.<br><br>One of the pushiest people I&#39;ve ever met. She:<br>- spilled my drink twice.<br>- never brought anything to clean up these drinks.  I had to use napkins. I never got a new one.   <br>- never let us finish what we were saying when answering one of her questions, or making a request. <br>- took my dinner plate away without asking, and I wasn&#39;t anywhere close to done. <br><br>It got to the point where it was laughable. However, it gives me all the more reason not to go back to this chain.  Should have stuck with my instincts. <br><br>Good luck

Not impressed with this location. Slow service. Took server a long time to return to the table after each request. Salty and greasy food. Had to send back my appetizer because it was burned. Manager did come out to apologize so that was good. Please re-visit your recipes. The lettuce wraps were too saucy, skimpy on the meat, and very salty.

Like Daniel said, the menu here is expansive.  I think the waitron told us there was something like over 100 menu items.  I will admit, I have stayed away from this place.  Generally, I am against large chainstyle restaurants.  When I have traveled to Chicago or KC, I remember friends saying, &#34;you&#39;ve got to eat at Cheesecake Factory&#34; and me thinking, right, I&#39;m not going to that place. <br><br>We went simply because my husband had received a gift card.  I wasn&#39;t excited but Ifigured it was a free meal.  It took me forever to decide what to get.   I finally decided on CHICKEN MADEIRA, their  Most Popular Chicken Dish (Sauteed Chicken Breast Topped with Fresh Asparagus and Melted Mozzarella Cheese, Covered with Fresh Mushroom Madeira Sauce.  Served with Mashed Potatoes).  THe portion size was huge. THe taste was wonderful.  I loved it.  Very much comfort food.  We also had the Spicy Ahi Tempura Rolls, which sounded really different and we really like them.  I think I could go there and get just appetizers, there are so many that sound good.  <br><br>My husband had the Navajo sandwich which comes on fry bread.  I had a taste and it was good.  <br><br>We were SOOOO full by the huge portions (and I took half of mine home) that we were too full for dessert.  We&#39;ll have to go back for cheesecake sometime.
Food was great.  Service was far from good, waiter was talking to his friends instead of doing his job, mentioned this to management and they made no attempt whatsoever to correct the situation.

Okay, so first let me say the cheesecake was amazing. I&#39;d go back for that, but my word was the rest of my experience abysmal. I ordered the veggie burger. 30-40 minutes later some man who didn&#39;t identify himself (maybe the manager? I have no idea because he just showed up at our table) comes over to tell me they are out of the veggie burger. Bummer, especially since it&#39;s one of the cheaper vegetarian entrees. So then I order a pasta dish that is about $5 more because he asks what else I want without giving me a menu and it&#39;s the only thing I can remember. And I get charged full price for the more expensive item that I didn&#39;t really want in the first place. You would think they would at least offer to let me pay for the cheaper veggie burger, but no. Ouch. And everything is so expensive to start with. The server was fine, the kind that would only stay at the table long enough to ask if you&#39;re enjoying everything okay but not stay for the answer. The food was alright, not worth the prices I&#39;m afraid. Or at least their pasta isn&#39;t worth $15 when it&#39;s identical to something you can get at Applebee&#39;s for half the price. I may try something different at a different Cheesecake Factory in the future, but really I&#39;m put off by the fact I got charged $15 for an entree I got stuck with because they were out of the $10 entree I wanted and they literally did nothing about the situation. I&#39;d be willing to bet there were veggie burgers in the back, they just wanted some extra $$$.<br>So in review: cheesecake is always good, they don&#39;t keep veggie burgers, and if you order something and they don&#39;t have it you&#39;re SOL because they will expect you to pay for something more expensive.

The thing about the Cheesecake Factory is its expansive menu.  They have a menu that reads like an encyclopedia of food.  When coupled with a nice new building and a good staff this is a great place to go when you do not know what you want to eat, but want something good.<br><br>Imagine Leonardo Da Vinci as a chef, he would work at the Cheesecake Factory.

We went here to eat this afternoon &amp; was surprised to get seated rather quickly, being told our server would soon be with us. Quite some time went by and a wonderful young waitress approached our table asking if we&#39;d been helped yet. We said no &amp; she immediately told us she tried to find who had our booth but wasn&#39;t going to leave us sit any longer. Took our order &amp; said she&#39;d tell them to put a rush in it as we&#39;d waited a long time and need to leave shortly. 15 minutes later my husband was served, 10 minutes later my daughter &amp; myself with an explanation that my fries were being cooked and they&#39;d bring them right out. No one ever came back until we were finished &amp; needed to leave. I was stuffed anyway as the portions were huge &amp; asked that they please just take them off my bill. She was mortified that we had such poor service &amp; took it upon herself to send the manager ( I assume ) over. He asked us what our experience was like &amp; we told him.... Not complaining... Because, STUFF HAPPENS. He said that&#39;s NOT the way they like to handle business ... They took our drinks off of our bill &amp; sent us home with 3 slices of DELICIOUS CHEESECAKE. All of our food was wonderful, a bit pricey but we knew that going in. We were very impressed with their insistence to apologize &amp; attempt to make it right....

After about a half hour wait, we were finally seated...on the first floor that had been closed when we walked in! Then after our timer/sensor went off, we still waited! When we finally asked, we were told that we belonged seated on the first floor....well, when were the gonna tell us? As for the food and service, delicious and great! Only 1 issue....my beans could&#39;ve been served hot!

I am shocked to see so many people having poor experiences at the Cheesecake Factory.  Wow, this place has good food &amp; a huge menu!  In fact, of the two times we&#39;ve been, I have been shocked at the fantastic food.  I usually go before prime hours and not on weekends and even then, service sometimes lags a bit but never to the point of being mad.  The prices are a bit high but I have no problem with it based on the huge portions and fantastic food.  I have to believe that the poor ratings were for dining during peak periods when service was stretched and maybe food was prepared through shortcuts.<br>Overall: HUGE menu, really good food, interesting atmosphere, slow service, long waits during peak times.

I was not impressed with this place.  It was busy and it was beautiful but my impressions dropped off from there.<br><br>I ordered a house salad but never actually tasted any salad dressing (thousand isaland) on it...it was bland... My son had a pizza...it was dry..I didn&#39;t see any sauce, we had to order marinara sauce so that he could choke it down...The burger my daughter ordered was unimpressive...<br><br>My waitress while friendly and efficient was almost stepford like...I got the impression it was the &#34;cheesecake way&#34;.. she was suppposed to act...I would have preferred casual and friendly...<br><br>I don&#39;t think this is one of those &#34;one time bad expreriences&#34; I think it was business as usual for this place..
I have always loved the cheese cake factory! Great food for a decent price. Awesome wait staff. And unique decor throughout.
I love everything I get from any Cheesecake Factory.  This location has good service and designed for families with children.
Katia our server was amazing, super friendly and very fast service. The food was excellent our whole experience was great! This was at the Green Valley Pkwy Henderson NV 89052.
amazing ranch. unique recipe, lots of garlic. <br>don&#39;t buy it in the bottle though, it doesn&#39;t keep well.

We recently moved to Nebraska and were hanging out in Omaha for the day and decided on The Cheesecake Factory for lunch. The menu was huge but we decided on the Renee&#39; lunchspecial or something like that. The food was good and we ordered 2 pieces of cheesecake to go because they looked good. The ones served in the restaurant to people around us were huge and seemingly worth the $8. BUT when we got home we were incredibly disappointed because the size of the slice was probably half the size of the ones served in the restaurant but they were still $8!!!! Totally ridiculous! Probably won&#39;t be coming back.

Terrible, terrible and terrible. The only reason I would except this one to have one star is that the server was nice. The tables were losing there varnish and the copper at the end of the table had never been polished. The interior was pretty lovely. My wife and I ordered two cocktails that tasted like the juice was really old. The Ahi Tartare was frozen tuna, don&#39;t eat AHI hear if you like AHI!  The Da Vinci pasta was made with really cheap penne. The chicken was bland. The Calabrian pizza slices fell downwards after grabbing a slice to take a bite. What really stood out was the wild mushroom soup. I couldn&#39;t help but have this taste in my mouth of uncleaned mushrooms. I could not taste anything else even when I tried to wash it out of my mouth. Looking around I did notice that other customers were leaving food almost untouched on there plates. There will be no reason to come back here again.

I ordered the lemon chicken with mushrooms. I forget the name, but it was really good. The sauce went great with the noodles. However, my wife had the other chicken special and it was extremely bland. No taste at all and was cold. We sent it back and the manager came over and apologized. Then we got the billed and noticed the waiter ordered me the huge $17 diner plate vs the $11 lunch special, which was the main purpose we went in for lunch. But it was too late, and didn&#39;t even feel like talking to them about it. The cheesecake was exceptionally well though, highly recommend that even if your full. This place upset our visit here.

I just don&#39;t even care if this is a corporation. I love it. Orange chicken, yes. Avocado roles, yes. Just all of it, yes. Maybe one thing could change: the prices. If I am going to die without it, I usually go when its the brunch menu.

Bland..bland...bland. Cheesecake Factory...where has your quality gone???!! From the salad to the entree, I was highly unimpressed. We actually sent my entree back because it was very bland, cold, and left a disgusting taste in my mouth. I think I had the same entree (chicken romano) a few years ago and it was very good. Very disappointed. Will not come back here again to pay $40 for a very bland, cold lunch. It appears chains are really starting to get worse. I hope this gives our small, family owned resturants a chance to break from the overpowering shadows of the massive amounts of chain resturants.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory over the weekend. It was busy probably because of the College World Series. It took 45 minutes to get our food. The manager stopped by our table and apologized for the delay and only offered us more bread!!! I felt we should have been offered a discount on the meal or on some cheesecake. I wasn&#39;t overly impressed with the food for the price. I mostly like won&#39;t go back.

The Cheesecake Factory use to be one of my favorite restaurants. The problem is that the menu is so huge that many items are dumped and replaced with new entrees. I have had so many favorite dishes in the past, but most are now gone! I was currently unimpressed with my last two trips because the new entrees only left me wanting some of my old favorites. Maybe, the Cheesecake Factory should sell the retired recipes in a cookbook because they are going to need the revenue growth someday soon! I can remember when people waited in line for almost an hour to be seated at this restaurant. Days gone by...... I would be interested in hearing other people mention a recipe that has been retired and is missed! In addition, do not even try to order the Strawberry Shortcake desert. The item is on the menu, but never available any longer. Strawberries are apparently now being reserved for the Cheesecake!

We had lunch there on Friday October 9th about 12:30 and there were 13 of us.  We were there for a a pre-wedding lunch with family.  They seated us right away at hightops by the bar area which was FANTASTIC!  Our waiter came over to us right away and took our drink orders (Everyone just ordered water, pop, or tea). We ordered 2 appetizers and were waiting for our bread but the bread never came.  Finally, after our appetizers came we asked for some bread - which usually bread comes as soon as you sit down.  We then all ordered.  My husband and I were the first to order and he got the pit beef sandwhich and I got the cajun chicken littles.  Everyone got their food except for my husband and I and one other person.  After about 10 minutes they brought the other persons food but still not ours.  We had to ask twice about our food and finally after everyone was 3/4 of the way done eating we got ours.  I think he had forgotten to put ours in or something.  It took quite awhile to get our checks and then he had messed up a couple of our checks - additional charges and he also gave someone the wrong credit card slip.  We were really running behind and it was taking forever to get our bill fixed and to get our food boxed up.  This waiter was very nice but either had never had a large group before or needed help.  It was not a good experience at all.  Our food was very good but the rest of the experience was very bad.

Really, how can they take so many delightful ingredients and beat all the flavor out of them?  It&#39;s not terrible, I admit.  It just doesn&#39;t seem to be much of anything at all.  I&#39;ve eaten there twice, and that was once too many.  My family shares bites all around, so we get to taste what everyone&#39;s having.  The verdict was unanimous: bland, uninspiring food, not worth the time or the money.  And you can get better-tasting cheesecake over at Whole Foods.

I don&#39;t know what everyone else on here is ordering, but I have never gotten bland food at The Cheesecake Factory in Omaha or anywhere else. I have tried several salads, a burger, club sandwich, meat sauce spaghetti, and the alfredo; none of them were bland although I wasn&#39;t super impressed with the alfredo. It is expensive but you get massive portions. My family likes to try everyone else&#39;s food when we eat out so this is a plus for us. The cheesecake is amazing if you have room for it. <br><br>My only complaint about the place is their ridiculous alcoholic drink prices. I went there by myself after shopping one afternoon and spent close to $30 on 3 drinks......wtf. They don&#39;t list the prices in the drink menu and they really aren&#39;t that great. I had their red sangria and it was decent, but not worth $9 a glass. Also the service seems to be either amazing or leaving you wonder if they are hiring randoms leaving the mall.
great service. &nbsp;great dessert.
